entry.headline: Portland General Electric Increases Dividend
entry.body:
Portland General Electric Increases Dividend

On May 11, 2011, the Board of Directors of Portland General Electric Company (NYSE:POR) declared a 2 percent increase in its quarterly common stock dividend, bringing the dividend to 26.5 cents per share, up from last quarter’s 26.0 cents per share.

“We are pleased to provide this dividend increase reflecting the strong operational performance and prudent financial management of our company,” said Jim Piro, president and chief executive officer of Portland General Electric. “Our strategy to make long-term investments in our core business allows us to meet the energy needs of our customers while delivering a competitive return for shareholders.”

PGE’s dividend is evaluated based on capital requirements and financial performance. Over the long term, the Company targets a dividend payout ratio in the 50-70 percent range, which is consistent with our peers.

The dividend is payable on or before July 15, 2011, to shareholders of record at the close of business on June 24, 2011.

About Portland General Electric Company

Portland General Electric, headquartered in Portland, Ore., is a fully integrated electric utility that serves approximately 821,000 residential, commercial and industrial customers in Oregon. Visit our Web site at www.PortlandGeneral.com.

POR-F

Source: Portland General Electric Company

Portland General Electric CompanyMedia Contact:Gail Baker, Director, Corporate Communications, 503-464-8693orInvestor Contact:Bill Valach, Director, Investor Relations, 503-464-7395

entry.headline: TTM Technologies, Inc. to Present at the JP Morgan Technology, Media and Telecom...
entry.body: TTM Technologies, Inc. to Present at the JP Morgan Technology, Media and Telecom Conference on May 18, 2011 SANTA ANA, Calif., May 11, 2011 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- TTM Technologies, Inc. (Nasdaq:TTMI), a leading manufacturer of time-critical, technologically advanced printed circuit boards, will participate in the JP Morgan Technology, Media and Telecom Conference on Wednesday, May 18, 2011, at 8:40 a.m. Eastern time. The conference is being held at the Westin Copley Place Hotel in Boston, Massachusetts. Kent Alder, President and CEO, and Steve Richards, CFO, will discuss TTM's successful strategy and its ability to capture market share in the printed circuit board industry. The presentation will be webcast on the company's website, www.ttmtech.com, and will remain accessible for one week following the event. TTM Technologies, Inc. is a major global printed circuit board manufacturer, focusing on quick-turn and technologically advanced PCBs and the backplane and sub-system assembly business. TTM stands for time-to-market, representing how the company's time-critical, one-stop manufacturing services enable customers to shorten the time required to develop new products and bring them to market. The TTM Technologies logo is available at http://www.globenewswire.com/newsroom/prs/?pkgid=5691 CONTACT: Steve Richards Chief Financial Officer 714/241-0303

entry.author: Noel Randewich
entry.headline: Google launches Chrome PCs, takes on Microsoft
entry.body:
SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Laptop computers using Google's Chrome operating system will go on sale in June, as the world's No. 1 Internet search engine challenges Microsoft Corp and Apple on their home turf.

The new Web-centric PCs, made by Samsung and Acer Inc, are Google's latest attempt to change how consumers and companies use their computers.

The bare-bones operating system is essentially a web browser that steers users to use applications like email and spreadsheets directly on the web, instead of storing software such as Outlook or Word directly on PCs.

Moving day-to-day functions onto the Internet removes the burden of time-consuming tasks associated with traditional PCs, like installing software and updates, backing up files and running antivirus checks, executives said.

"The complexity of managing your computer is torturing users," Google cofounder Sergey Brin told reporters. "It's a flawed model fundamentally. Chromebooks are a new model that doesn't put the burden of managing your computer on yourself."

In another move encouraging people to move their computing off their PCs and onto "the cloud", Google on Tuesday launched an online music locker service letting users store and listen to their songs wherever they are.

For nearly two years Google has touted Chrome as an alternative to Microsoft Windows, which is used on more than 90 percent of the world's PCs, but faced delays launching laptops designed to use the software.

Meanwhile, the exploding market for smartphones and tablets using Google's Android operating system has quickly taken center stage for the Internet heavyweight, and some observers say Google should reconcile or merge the two.

"Our goal is to focus on the users and bring the best forward. Wherever we can share (technology with Android) we will share," said Sundar Pichai, Senior Vice President of Chrome. "But the final expressions are two different visions."

DRIVING ADS

As with Android, Chrome software will be free, but is expected to spur people to use the Internet more often and search for more things, potentially boosting Google's Internet ads business.

The operating system and "Chromebook" PCs expand on Google's web browser, also called Chrome, that competes against Microsoft's Internet Explorer.

The laptops, using processors made by Intel, will be available for order on Amazon.com and Best Buy's online store on June 15.

The Mountain View, California company will also offer businesses its Chromebooks, along with technical support, as a hassle-free solution for $28 a month.

Google is competing fiercely against Apple to win consumers in the mobile market, with sales of Android-based phones recently overtaking iPhones but with its own tablets far behind Apple's iPad.

Google kicked off its annual developers forum on Tuesday with an image of its Android robot eating an apple, a shot at its Cupertino, California rival.

Also on Tuesday, Microsoft said it would buy popular Internet phone service Skype for $8.5 billion, beating out bids by Google and Facebook and highlighting its need to gain new customers for Windows as more consumers turn from PCs to mobile gadgets.

Shares of Google were down 1.57 percent at $534.12.

(Reporting by Noel Randewich; editing by Maureen Bavdek, Bernard Orr)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman Sachs backs down from ROE target -analyst
entry.body:
* Management will not endorse high-teen ROE target -analyst

* No new target provided

* Regulatory reform, trading downturn may crimp earnings

By Lauren Tara LaCapra

NEW YORK, May 11 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) management appears to be backing down from earlier return-on-equity targets, citing regulatory uncertainty and trading volume declines, Barclays Capital analyst Roger Freeman wrote on Wednesday.

After meeting with senior Goldman executives, Freeman said the bank is not "endorsing" any return on equity number, including management's earlier target. The executives would not provide Freeman with an updated target, nor did they lower their estimates, saying the outlook is too clouded.

"We do not believe that management backing off the prior 20% return on tangible equity target is a surprise to the market," said Freeman. "At the same time, management declined to provide a new target due to the widely variable inputs still outstanding."

Return on equity is a measure of how effectively the bank wrings profit out of its equity capital. Before the financial crisis struck, Goldman had posted returns on equity above 30 percent.

Freeman's comments are the latest signal that it will be more difficult for Goldman and its Wall Street peers to meet targets that were set in a more optimistic atmosphere just after the credit crisis abated.

At a conference in November, Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein hinted that he was less certain about the outlook for Goldman's return-on-equity, citing market factors and the need to hold more capital. Ultimately, he stuck by management's earlier targets.

Freeman thinks it will take another six to 12 months for management to provide additional details.

Goldman Sachs spokesman Stephen Cohen said the bank does not comment on analyst reports.

Last quarter, Goldman posted an annualized ROE of 14.5 percent, excluding the impact of a one-time charge to repurchase preferred stock from Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N).

Goldman shares closed 1.7 percent lower at $147.88 on Wednesday. The stock has declined 10.6 percent this year. (Reporting by Lauren Tara LaCapra, editing by Matthew Lewis)

National CineMedia, Inc. (NASDAQ: NCMI) (the Company), the managing member and owner of 48.6% of National CineMedia, LLC (NCM LLC), the operator of the largest digital in-theatre network in North America, today announced that the Company will participate at the following investor conferences:

The NCM Cinema Network and NCM Fathom present cinema advertising and events across the nation’s largest digital in-theater network, comprised of theaters owned by AMC Entertainment Inc., Cinemark Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: CNK), Regal Entertainment Group (NYSE: RGC) and other leading regional theater circuits. NCM’s theater advertising network covers 170 Designated Market Areas® (49 of the top 50) and includes approximately 17,200 screens (16,100 digital). During 2010, over 680 million patrons attended movies shown in theaters currently included in NCM’s network (including Consolidated Theatres, Rave Cinemas, Coming Attractions and Digiplex Destinations). The NCM Fathom Events broadcast network is comprised of over 600 locations in 163 Designated Market Areas® (all of the top 50). The NCM Interactive Network offers 360-degree integrated marketing opportunities in combination with cinema, encompassing 43 entertainment-related websites, online widgets and mobile applications. entry.headline: Photronics to Present at the J.P. Morgan Global Technology, Media and Telecom Conference
entry.body:
Photronics to Present at the J.P. Morgan Global Technology, Media and Telecom Conference

Photronics, Inc. (NASDAQ:PLAB), a worldwide leader in supplying innovative imaging technology solutions for the global electronics industry, is scheduled to present at the J.P. Morgan Global Technology, Media and Telecom Conference on Wednesday, May 18, 2011 at 10:40 a.m. ET at the Westin Copley Place in Boston. A live webcast of the presentation can be accessed at www.photronics.com.

Photronics is a leading worldwide manufacturer of photomasks. Photomasks are high precision quartz plates that contain microscopic images of electronic circuits. A key element in the manufacture of semiconductors and flat panel displays, photomasks are used to transfer circuit patterns onto semiconductor wafers and flat panel substrates during the fabrication of integrated circuits, a variety of flat panel displays and, to a lesser extent, other types of electrical and optical components. They are produced in accordance with product designs provided by customers at strategically located manufacturing facilities in Asia, Europe, and North America. Additional information on the Company can be accessed at www.photronics.com.

The Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 provides a “safe harbor” for forward-looking statements made by or on behalf of Photronics, Inc. and its subsidiaries (the Company). The forward-looking statements contained in this press release and other parts of Photronics’ web site involve risks and uncertainties that may affect the Company’s operations, markets, products, services, prices, and other factors. These risks and uncertainties include, but are not limited to, economic, competitive, legal, governmental, and technological factors. entry.headline: Visa anuncia a próxima geração de pagamentos e serviços eletrônicos
entry.body:
Visa anuncia a próxima geração de pagamentos e serviços eletrônicos

Nova carteira digital com a funcionalidade “Clique para comprar” está chega aos Estados Unidos e no Canadá no segundo semestre de 2011

A Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), líder mundial em pagamentos eletrônicos, anuncia hoje a próxima geração de soluções de pagamento que irá levar a facilidade, confiança e segurança dos pagamentos realizados nos pontos de venda para o comércio eletrônico, pagamentos com celular e em redes sociais. As novas ofertas incluem uma carteira digital segura para diferentes canais e uma variedade de serviços de pagamentos móveis customizados que atendem aos requerimentos específicos de cada mercado ao redor do mundo.

“Nossas novas soluções entregam maior escolha, conveniência e controle ao consumidor, enquanto ajudam nossos clientes a crescerem seus negócios. Ao ajudar a reduzir o número de compras online abandonadas no meio do processo e ao trazer mais portadores de cartão para a rede Visa, criamos uma relação na qual comércios, consumidores e instituições financeiras sempre saem ganhando”, relata Joseph W. Saunders, CEO da Visa Inc. “Além disso, acreditamos que os novos serviços e pagamentos Visa contribuirão para a expansão da inclusão financeira de bilhões de portadores de telefones celulares que atualmente não têm acesso aos serviços financeiros tradicionais”.

Simplificando o comércio em economias complexas

Em países que já possuem uma infraestrutura estabelecida de pagamentos eletrônicos, grande penetração de Internet e de telefonia móvel, a Visa irá lançar uma carteira digital e uma plataforma de serviços. A carteira digital irá armazenar cartões Visa e não-Visa, apoiar os pagamentos de near field communication (NFC) por meio de uma aplicação inovadora Visa payWave e uma série de serviços de transação para acomodar cenários múltiplos de comércio – como e-commerce, compras com o celular, micropagamentos, redes sociais e pagamentos entre pessoas físicas.

A Visa está trabalhando com emissores líderes em pagamento, bancos comunitários, financeiras, adquirentes, processadoras de pagamento e estabelecimentos comerciais para lançar a carteira digital. Entre as instituições financeiras e organizações que estão apoiando a estratégia da carteira da Visa estão:

Barclaycard US BBT Corporation Card Services for Credit Unions (CSCU) ICBA Bancard First Financial Bank of Ohio Nordstrom fsb Pentagon Federal Credit Union PNC Bank PSCU Financial Services Regions Bank Royal Bank of Canada Scotiabank TD Bank Group (US and Canada) US Bank

A Visa espera lançar a carteira digital nos Estados Unidos e no Canadá durante o outono de 2011 do hemisfério norte.

As principais características da carteira digital são:

Funcionalidade “clique para comprar”: permite comprar de forma conveniente e segura simplesmente digitando um endereço de e-mail ou usuário e senha, ao invés de digitar o endereço de cobrança, os números do cartão e a data de validade. Além disso, a Visa irá explorar as tecnologias de autenticação dinâmica que trazem mais camadas de segurança para as compras on-line. Solução de pagamento multi-canal: a carteira consolida várias contas de cartão Visa e não-Visa e pode ser usada em pagamentos com o celular, comércio eletrônico, redes sociais e pontos de venda varejistas. Gerenciamento de preferências: um menu que permite aos consumidores definir preferências de como sua carteira irá funcionar, podendo customizar e controlar os recursos e opções de privacidade da sua carteira pessoal para designar quais cartões serão acessados dependendo do tipo de comércio ou valor da compra. Ofertas dos comércios: um serviço que permite que consumidores personalizem sua experiência de compras para receber descontos ou promoções de estabelecimentos comerciais participantes.

"A ampla adoção da Internet e da tecnologia móvel está mudando a maneira das pessoas se conectarem e realizarem transações em todo o mundo, por isso, estamos focados em fornecer produtos e serviços de pagamentos adaptados localmente”, diz Saunders. "Estamos lançando novas soluções para o comércio eletrônico e para celulares que proporcionam a mesma confiança, segurança e conveniência que os portadores de cartão experimentam quando estão usando seus cartões Visa em uma loja física. Ao fazer isso, estamos acelerando a mudança global para os pagamentos digitais aproveitando a força da nossa marca, produtos, rede e os nossos mais de 50 anos de experiência em pagamentos."

Mobilizando Pagamentos em Economias Emergentes

Em mercados emergentes com penetração significativa de telefonia móvel, a Visa trabalhará junto com as instituições financeiras e operadoras de redes móveis para oferecer aos consumidores uma maneira segura, confiável e mundialmente aceita de pagamentos e a capacidade de transferir e receber fundos, gerenciar contas financeiras e comprar créditos para seus celulares usando seus aparelhos. A ampla variedade de funcionalidades que está sendo desenvolvida para a carteira digital irá permitir que a Visa desenvolva uma série de estratégias para adequar os serviços às necessidades locais.

Em países como Índia e Rússia, onde os números de emissão de cartões e de assinaturas de celulares são bastante altos, mas o uso do cartão é relativamente baixo, a Visa conduzirá o trabalho de ativação e uso de produtos com instituições financeiras e operadoras de telefonia móvel para conectar o portfólio de cartões existentes com dispositivos móveis, agregando a eles a funcionalidade de pagamento. Em países da África e Oriente Médio, onde o uso de celulares é alto e a infraestrutura de pagamentos eletrônicos é menos desenvolvida, a Visa trabalhará com as operadoras de telefonia móvel para conectar novas contas virtuais de pré-pago Visa aos números do telefones celulares permitindo a entrada e saída de dinheiro, pagamentos pessoais e pagamentos móveis – incluindo pagamentos de contas e recarga de celular. A Visa também pretende conectar os já existentes serviços básicos de pagamento móveis “fechados” – que hoje atendem os consumidores não-bancarizados ou sub-bancarizados – à rede aberta e global da Visa. A integração irá abrir sistemas fechados e oferecer a consumidores e estabelecimentos comerciais escala sem precedentes de funcionalidade e aceitação.

Em todos os mercados emergentes, a tecnologia sofisticada de pagamentos da Visa e os trabalhos significativos feitos para estabelecer padrões globais de pagamento serão úteis para o entendimento do complexo universo de operadores, modelos de aparelho celular e sistemas em uso no mundo, permitindo que milhões de novos e já existentes portadores de cartão Visa possam simplificar o uso da tecnologia móvel para serviços de pagamento.

Inovação, aquisições e parcerias expandem as capacidades da rede Visa

A Visa está desenvolvendo sua nova geração de serviços através da integração de sua rede global de processamento, oferecendo para suas plataformas de produto de crédito, débito, pré-pago e comercial novas funcionalidades adquiridas através das suas subsidiárias CyberSource, Authorize.net e PlaySpan, e o conhecimento e os serviços únicos de seus parceiros comerciais. Na implementação de soluções flexíveis, relevantes localmente e globalmente interoperáveis, a Visa pretende atrair mais participantes para a sua rede e permitir que eles se conectem e realizem transações de forma melhor.

"Nossa abordagem de construir, comprar e realizar parcerias coloca a Visa em uma posição única para fornecer velocidade para o mercado e soluções escalonáveis necessárias para ficar à frente de novas demandas criadas pela convergência da Internet, tecnologias móveis e de pagmentos eletrônicos”, afirma Saunders. "A Visa e suas subsidiárias estão trabalhando com instituições financeiras, operadoras de telefonia móvel e provedores inovadores de tecnologia para trazer novas formas de pagar e receber a mais consumidores e comerciantes ao redor do globo".

Sobre a Visa:

A Visa é uma companhia global de tecnologia de pagamento que conecta consumidores, empresas, instituições financeiras e governos em mais de 200 países e territórios com uma moeda digital rápida, segura e confiável. Esta moeda digital tem o suporte de uma das redes de processamento mais avançada do mundo – a Rede Visa – capaz de processar mais de 20 mil transações por segundo, com proteção contra fraudes para os consumidores e garantia de recebimento aos comércios. A Visa não é um banco, não emite cartões, não concede crédito ou fixa juros e taxas aos consumidores. As inovações da Visa permitem às suas instituições financeiras clientes oferecerem mais opções aos consumidores finais: pagar na hora com o débito, adiantado com o pré-pago ou depois com os produtos de crédito. Para mais informações, visite www.visa.com.br.

Declarações Prospectivas

Este press release contem declarações prospectivas dentro do conceito da U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act de 1995. Essas declarações podem ser identificadas pelo termo “espera” e outras referências similares ao futuro. Exemplos dessas declarações prospectivas incluem - mas não são limitadas - tempo de finalização da aquisição e seu prospectivo efeito diluído nos resultados da Visa por ação. Por sua natureza, declarações prospectivas: (i) referem-se apenas as datas em que foram feitas, (ii) não são declarações de fatos históricos nem garantias de desempenho futuro e (iii) estão sujeitas aos riscos, incertezas, suposições e mudanças em circunstancias em que são difíceis de prever ou de quantificar. Portanto, resultados reais podem divergir materialmente e adversamente das declarações prospectivas em função de uma série de fatores, incluindo aprovações regulatórias, o risco de que o novo negócio não seja satisfatoriamente integrado ao negócio da Visa, os custos associados com a aquisição, crescimento desacelerado do eCommerce e outros fatores apresentados no tópico "Risk Factors" do nosso mais recente Relatório Anual, no Form 10-K e em nosso mais recente Relatório Trimestral no Form 10-Q. Você não deve depositar confiança indevida em tais declarações. A menos que sejamos obrigados por Lei, não temos a intenção de atualizar ou revisar nenhuma declaração prospectiva por conta de novas informações, futuras evoluções ou outras razões.

Visa do BrasilSabrina Sciama, (11) 2102-0021ssciama@visa.comouKetchum EstratégiaCecília Amaral, (11) 5090-8934cecília.amaral@ketchum.com.brouKetchum EstratégiaFernanda Francisco, (11) 5090-8936fernanda.francisco@ketchum.com.br

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Visa revela la próxima generación de pagos y servicios electrónicos
entry.body:
Visa revela la próxima generación de pagos y servicios electrónicos

Nuevo Monedero Digital con la Funcionalidad “Clic para Comprar” llega a América del Norte a tiempo para la temporada de compras de final de año

Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), líder global en los pagos electrónicos, anunció hoy la próxima generación de soluciones de pago que replicará la facilidad, confiabilidad y seguridad de los pagos con Visa en el punto de venta dentro de los ambientes tradicionales y digitales de comercio electrónico y comercio a través de dispositivos móviles, así como en los florecientes ambientes de comercio a través de redes sociales. Las nuevas ofertas incluyan un monedero digital seguro que funciona a través de diversos canales y una gama de servicios de pago con dispositivo móvil personalizados que atiendan los requisitos específicos de los mercados en diversas zonas geográficas alrededor del mundo.

“Nuestras nuevas soluciones entregan más opciones, más conveniencia y control al consumidor y al mismo tiempo ayudan a nuestros clientes a promover el crecimiento de su negocio. Ayudando a reducir el número de carritos de compras en línea que los consumidores simplemente abandonan, e incorporando a nuevos titulares de cuentas a la red Visa, creamos una situación donde todos ganan, tanto los comercios como los consumidores y las instituciones financieras”, expresó Joseph W. Saunders, Presidente de la Junta Directiva y Principal Funcionario Ejecutivo de Visa Inc. “Además, creemos que los nuevos productos y servicios de pago de Visa ayudarán a expandir la inclusión financiera a los miles de millones de suscriptores de teléfonos móviles que actualmente carecen de acceso a los servicios financieros tradicionales”.

Simplificando el comercio en economías complejas

En los países que cuentan con infraestructuras de pago electrónico establecidas, uso generalizado de Internet y una amplia penetración por parte de las redes de telefonía móvil, Visa introducirá una plataforma de monedero y servicios digitales. El monedero digital guardará las cuentas de pago Visa y otras cuentas que no sean cuentas Visa, brindará soporte a los pagos por comunicación de campos cercanos (NFC) a través de la innovadora aplicación Visa payWave, y entregará una amplia diversidad de servicios transaccionales a fin de prestar servicio en múltiples entornos de comercio, incluyendo el comercio electrónico, el comercio móvil, los micropagos, los pagos en redes sociales y los pagos persona a persona.

Visa está colaborando con emisores de tarjetas de pago, bancos comunitarios, uniones de crédito, adquirentes, procesadores de pago y comercios líderes para lanzar el monedero digital. Entre las instituciones financieras y organizaciones que apoyan la estrategia de monedero digital de Visa figuran:

Barclaycard US BBT Corporation Card Services for Credit Unions (CSCU) ICBA Bancard First Financial Bank of Ohio Nordstrom fsb Pentagon Federal Credit Union PNC Bank PSCU Financial Services Regions Bank Royal Bank of Canada Scotiabank TD Bank Group (US and Canada) US Bank

Visa espera lanzar el monedero digital en Estados Unidos y Canadá en el otoño del 2011.

Las principales características del monedero son:

Funcionalidad “Clic para Comprar”: Se podrán hacer compras de forma conveniente y segura simplemente ingresando una dirección de correo electrónico, alias o nombre de usuario en línea y contraseña, en lugar de la dirección de facturación, el número de cuenta y la fecha de vencimiento. Además, Visa está explorando tecnologías de autenticación dinámica que incorporarán más capas de seguridad a fin de brindar protección adicional a las compras en línea. Solución de pago a través de diferentes canales: El monedero consolida múltiples cuentas de pago Visa y no Visa, y se puede usar en ambientes de venta por dispositivo móvil, comercio electrónico y redes sociales, así como en el punto de venta en comercios minoristas. Gestión de preferencias: Un menú que permite al consumidor establecer preferencias para gestionar la forma en la que funcionará su monedero, permitiéndole personalizar y controlar las características y funciones de su monedero personal, desde proteger su privacidad hasta designar a cuál cuenta se accederá, según el tipo de comercio o monto de la compra. Ofertas de comercios: Un servicio que permite al consumidor personalizar su experiencia de compra y optar por recibir descuentos o promociones de comercios participantes para ahorrar dinero.

“La adopción generalizada de Internet y la tecnología de comunicación móvil está cambiando la forma en que la gente se conecta y realiza transacciones en el mundo entero, y por eso estamos focalizados en entregar productos y servicios de pago hechos a la medida de las necesidades locales”, dijo Saunders. “Estamos introduciendo nuevas soluciones para el comercio electrónico y los dispositivos móviles que proporcionan la misma experiencia de ‘calidad Visa’, es decir conveniencia, confiabilidad y seguridad, que la gente disfruta al usar una tarjeta Visa en una tienda. Al hacerlo así, estamos acelerando el cambio a los pagos digitales a nivel global al aprovechar al máximo nuestra marca, nuestros productos, red y más de 50 años de experiencia en pagos”.

Movilizando los pagos en las economías emergentes

En ciertos mercados emergentes en zonas geográficas con significativa penetración de telefonía móvil, Visa colaborará con las instituciones financieras y operadores de redes de telefonía móvil para brindar a los consumidores una forma de pago segura, confiable y mundialmente aceptada, así como la habilidad de transferir y recibir fondos, gestionar cuentas financieras o recargar tiempo aire inalámbrico utilizando su teléfono móvil. La gran diversidad de características y funciones que se están desarrollando para el monedero digital permitirá a Visa perseguir diversas estrategias para personalizar servicios o agruparlos en paquetes que atiendan las necesidades locales.

En países como India y Rusia, donde la emisión de tarjetas y la suscripción a servicios de telefonía móvil son altas pero el uso de tarjetas es relativamente bajo, Visa ayudará a promover la activación y el uso trabajando con las instituciones financieras y los operadores de telefonía móvil para enlazar los portafolios de tarjetas existentes con los dispositivos móviles, a fin de brindar la funcionalidad de pago en los teléfonos. En países de África y el Oriente Medio donde el uso de dispositivos móviles es alto y la infraestructura de pago electrónico tradicional está menos desarrollada, Visa trabajará con los operadores de telefonía móvil para enlazar nuevas cuentas Visa prepagadas virtuales móviles con los números de teléfonos móviles, a fin de habilitar los servicios de efectivo cash-in y cash-out, los pagos personales y los pagos con dispositivo móvil, incluyendo el pago de facturas y la recarga de tiempo aire inalámbrico. Visa también se propone conectar los sistemas cerrados de dinero móvil que hoy proporcionan servicios básicos de banca móvil y pago a través del dispositivo móvil a consumidores no bancarizados o poco bancarizados, con su red abierta global, VisaNet. Esta integración abrirá los sistemas cerrados y proporcionará a consumidores y comercios una escala, funcionalidad y aceptación sin precedente, más allá de su entorno geográfico local actual.

A través de todos los mercados emergentes en diversas zonas geográficas, la sofisticada tecnología de pago y significativo trabajo de Visa para establecer estándares de pago globales ayudarán a navegar las complejidades que plantean la miríada de operadores de redes, modelos de teléfonos y sistemas operativos que actualmente se usan en el mundo, creando las condiciones para que millones de titulares de cuentas Visa nuevos y existentes puedan utilizar de forma simple la tecnología móvil para realizar pagos.

La innovación, las adquisiciones y alianzas expanden las capacidades de la red de Visa

Visa está desarrollando sus servicios de próxima generación integrando a VisaNet, su red de procesamiento global, plataformas de productos líderes de crédito, débito, prepagados y comerciales, las nuevas capacidades que ha adquirido a través de sus subsidiarias CyberSource, Authorize.net y PlaySpan, y el conocimiento experto y servicios únicos de sus socios comerciales clave. Al implementar soluciones flexibles que son localmente relevantes y globalmente interoperables, Visa se propone atraer a más participantes a su red y darles una mayor capacidad para conectarse y transaccionar.

“Nuestro enfoque de desarrollo, adquisición y alianza coloca a Visa en una posición única para generar la rapidez de implementación en el mercado y las soluciones escalables necesarias para mantenernos un paso adelante de las nuevas demandas creadas por la convergencia de Internet y las tecnologías de comunicación móvil y pagos electrónicos”, señaló Saunders. “Visa y sus subsidiarias están trabajando con instituciones financieras, comercios, operadores de redes de telefonía móvil y proveedores de innovaciones tecnológicas para proporcionar nuevas formas de pagar y recibir pago a más consumidores y comercios en el mundo entero”.

Presentación en línea del equipo ejecutivo

El equipo ejecutivo de Visa ofrecerá hoy en vivo una presentación de audio en línea, la cual comenzará a las 11:00 a.m., hora del este (8:00 a.m., hora del Pacífico). El teléfono para conectarse con la llamada es 888-790-4410 (dentro de Estados Unidos) o 773-756-0127 (internacional). El código de ingreso para unirse a la conferencia es 092075. Posteriormente, hasta el 26 de mayo, se podrá acceder a la grabación de la llamada marcando el 866-501-8774 (dentro de Estados Unidos) o 203-369-1854 (internacional). También se puede acceder a la llamada en vivo y posteriormente a la grabación de la misma a través de la sección de Relaciones con Inversionistas del sitio Web de Visa en www.investor.visa.com.

###

Acerca de Visa

Visa es una compañía global de tecnología de pago que conecta a consumidores, empresas, instituciones financieras y gobiernos en más de 200 países y territorios con una moneda digital rápida, segura y confiable. Esa moneda digital se apoya en la red de procesamiento más avanzada del mundo—VisaNet—que es capaz de procesar más de 20.000 transacciones por segundo, brindando protección contra fraudes a los consumidores y pago garantizado a los comercios. Aunque Visa no es un banco y no emite tarjetas, extiende crédito ni fija tasas o cuotas para el consumidor, las innovaciones de Visa sí habilitan a sus instituciones financieras clientes para ofrecer más opciones a los consumidores, a fin de que puedan pagar al momento con la tarjeta de débito, pagar por anticipado mediante una tarjeta prepagada, o pagar más tarde con una tarjeta de crédito. Para obtener información más detallada, visite www.corporate.visa.com.

Declaraciones con vistas al futuro

Este comunicado de prensa contiene ciertas declaraciones con vistas al futuro dentro de la definición dada en la ley conocida como U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Estas declaraciones se pueden identificar por el uso de verbos conjugados en futuro y los términos “espera”, “se espera”, “tiene intenciones de”, “se propone”, “acelerar”, “expandir” y referencias similares al futuro. Los ejemplos de dichas declaraciones con vistas al futuro incluyen, sin estar limitadas a las mismas, expresiones relacionadas con las fechas, el impacto, el contenido, la confiabilidad, aceptación, implementación y el éxito general del nuevo monedero digital y pago con dispositivo móvil, y ofertas. Por su misma naturaleza, las declaraciones con vistas al futuro: (i) hablan sólo en la fecha en que se hacen, (ii) no constituyen declaraciones de hechos históricos ni garantías de desempeño futuro, y (iii) están sujetas a riesgos, incertidumbres, supuestos y cambios que son difíciles de predecir o cuantificar. Por lo tanto, los resultados reales podrían diferir en forma sustancial y adversa de esas declaraciones con vistas al futuro debido a una diversidad de factores que incluyen:

el impacto de nuevas leyes, regulaciones y barreras en el mercado, particularmente las que afectan el comercio electrónico, los pagos con dispositivos móviles, la privacidad del consumidor y el uso y la seguridad de los datos; factores macroeconómicos como las condiciones económicas, políticas, de salud y ambientales a nivel mundial; una disminución en el crecimiento de la actividad de comercio electrónico y pagos con dispositivos móviles; la falta de habilidad para mantenerse al día con respecto a las innovaciones de los competidores en las áreas de comercio electrónico y pagos con dispositivos móviles; desarrollos sistémicos y de la industria como, por ejemplo: presión competitiva en los precios; consolidación de bancos y comercios y su creciente focalización en los costos; cambios adversos en nuestras relaciones y reputación; interrupciones de nuestros sistemas o la falta de habilidad para procesar transacciones en forma eficiente; violaciones de seguridad de datos de cuentas y aumento de la actividad fraudulenta y otras actividades ilegales que involucren nuestros sistemas; y problemas que surjan en Visa Europa, incluyendo el no poder mantener la interoperabilidad entre nuestros sistemas;

Y los otros factores discutidos bajo el subtítulo “Factores de Riesgo” en nuestro Informe Anual en el Formulario 10-K más reciente presentado a la U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Usted no debe depender en forma indebida de dichas declaraciones. A menos que la ley nos lo requiera, no es nuestra intención actualizar ni modificar ninguna de las declaraciones con vistas al futuro debido a nueva información, futuros desarrollos u otras razones.

Visa Inc., América Latina y el CaribeClaudia Parazzoli, +1-305-328-1268cparazzo@visa.comoBurson-MarstellerValerie Jaimes, +1-305-347-4359valerie.jaimes@bm.com

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 2-RESEARCH ALERT-JPMorgan's legal expenses weigh
entry.body:
* Costs for suits over mortgage securities to remain high

* Billions of dollars more to pay -Bernstein's McDonald

* Analyst cuts 2011 EPS estimate by $0.20, 2012 by $0.10 (Rewrites throughout; adds detail on JPMorgan's legal expenses, adds dateline)

By David Henry

NEW YORK, May 11 (Reuters) - Lawsuits stemming from bad mortgage loans will cost JPMorgan Chase Co (JPM.N) billions of dollars over coming quarters, a veteran Wall Street analyst said on Wednesday.

The bank had $7.4 billion of legal expenses last year, and JPMorgan's chief financial officer believes it could face similar expenses in the future, wrote John McDonald of Bernstein Research in a report to clients.

The report shows how banks are still suffering from the financial crisis, as homeowners, bond investors, lenders and other parties argue over who should bear the losses from bad mortgages.

McDonald reduced his 2011 and 2012 earnings estimates for JPMorgan, citing legal costs as well as the bank's investments in its business.

JPMorgan's legal expenses have been rising in the wake of the financial crisis. The bank reported $161 million in expenses for litigation in 2009, and for 2008, when it reduced reserves, a $781 million benefit.

In the first quarter of this year, the bank recorded $1.1 billion for lawsuit costs, down from $2.9 billion in the same quarter a year ago.

McDonald met Thursday with JPMorgan CFO Doug Braunstein. The CFO expects the bank's expense base to remain at what McDonald called "cyclically elevated levels for the foreseeable future."

Braunstein declined to comment on McDonald's report, said bank spokesman Howard Opinsky.

Braunstein said in an April 13 conference call with analysts that he did not view first quarter costs for mortgage foreclosures and litigation "as run-rate expense, but, to be clear, there could be further costs around this matter before we are finished."

All big banks are dealing with multiple lawsuits, government investigations and demands for refunds by investors in mortgage-related securities in the aftermath of housing market collapse. JPMorgan disclosed last week that it is in "advanced discussions" with the staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to resolve some of those cases.

JPMorgan Chief Executive Jamie Dimon said in an April 4 letter to shareholders that the bank will be dealing with legal issues from the credit market storm "for years to come."

McDonald cut his estimate for JPMorgan's 2011 earnings per share by 20 cents to $4.70 and his 2012 estimate by 10 cents to $5.65. The bank earned $3.96 in 2010.

In afternoon trading, JPMorgan shares were down 90 cents or 2 percent to $44.26. (Reporting by David Henry, additional reporting by Aditi Sharma in Bangalore)

entry.headline: Treasury Metals Announces the Appointment of Martin Walter as President and CEO
entry.body: TORONTO, ONTARIO, May 11 (MARKET WIRE) -- Treasury Metals Inc. ("Treasury Metals" or the "Company") (TSX: TML) announced today that Dr. Scott Jobin-Bevans has stepped down as President and as a Director of the Board. Martin Walter, the current Chief Executive Officer (CEO) who joined the Company in December 2010, will assume the expanded role of President and CEO. Dr. Jobin-Bevans will continue to be involved with the Goliath Gold Project as a consultant working with the Company's management team on the development and expansion of the project. Over the past several months, the Company expanded the management team including Mr. Walter who brings more than 15 years of operational and international mineral and mine development experience. Dennis Gibson was appointed as Chief Financial Officer and Greg Ferron joined as Vice President of Corporate Development. On the technical side, Andrew Cheatle, formerly of Goldcorp Inc., joined the Company in January 2011 as Vice President of Exploration. Since joining, Mr. Cheatle has assembled a technical team of geologists and has assumed the management of day-to-day operations at the Goliath Gold Project. The Board of Directors would like to thank Scott for his valuable contributions to the Company from the IPO in August 2008 until now. In addition, the Company has scheduled its Annual General Meeting of Shareholders on the 9th of June at 2:30 pm to be held at the Toronto Board of Trade. The purpose of the meeting will be the presentation and approval of the audited statements, election of directors, appointment of auditors and for a general corporate update. To learn more about Treasury Metals please visit the Company's website at www.treasurymetals.com. Forward-looking Statements This release includes certain statements that may be deemed to be "forward-looking statements". All statements in this release, other than statements of historical facts, that address events or developments that management of the Company expect, are forward-looking statements. Actual results or developments may differ materially from those in forward-looking statements. Treasury Metals disclaims any intention or obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, save and except as may be required by applicable securities laws. Contacts: Treasury Metals Inc. Greg Ferron Vice President Corporate Development 1.416.214.4654 greg@treasurymetals.com Treasury Metals Inc. Martin Walter CEO and President 1.416.214.4654 martin@treasurymetals.com www.treasurymetals.com Copyright 2011, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

The New York Times Company to Webcast Its Presentation at the J.P. Morgan 39th Annual Global Technology, Media and Telecom Conference

The New York Times Company (NYSE: NYT) announced today that it will participate in the J.P. Morgan 39th Annual Global Technology, Media and Telecom Conference in Boston on Wednesday, May 18, 2011. The Company’s presentation is scheduled for 8:40 a.m. E.T. A link to the live webcast of the presentation will be available via the Company’s Web site at http://www.nytco.com/investors/index.html. An archive of the webcast will also be available in the Investors section of the Company’s site for 30 days.

The New York Times Company, a leading media company with 2010 revenues of $2.4 billion, includes The New York Times, the International Herald Tribune, The Boston Globe, 15 other daily newspapers and more than 50 Web sites, including NYTimes.com, Boston.com and About.com. The Company’s core purpose is to enhance society by creating, collecting and distributing high-quality news, information and entertainment.

This press release can be downloaded from www.nytco.com

entry.headline: California Student Named Recipient of the Coca-Cola Johnston Legacy Scholarship
entry.body:
California Student Named Recipient of the Coca-Cola Johnston Legacy Scholarship

Local high school student joins elite academic group of 100 2011 winners of annual Coca-Cola college scholarships

Coca-Cola has awarded a one-time $5,000 scholarship to Dustin Kobs of Lafayette, Calif., for academic excellence and leadership.

Kobs, who has applied to attend San Diego State University, http://www.sdsu.edu/ is the son of Greg Kobs, who is the supply chain manager for Coca-Cola Refreshments distribution center in Union City.

“I am very excited to start my college adventure and this scholarship gives me a head start,” said Kobs, who said he plans to study psychology and kinesiology because of his interest in sports therapy.

Kobs is one of 100 distinguished students selected from applications submitted by Coca-Cola employees on behalf of their children nationwide.

“We are so proud to be able to help our employees further their children’s education and reap the rewards of hard work and good citizenships,” said William O’Brien, senior vice president of sales for Coca-Cola Refreshments in the Northwest Region.

In 2001, Coca-Cola Enterprises, the largest bottling company for brands of The Coca-Cola Company in the United States and Canada, established the Johnston Legacy Scholarship program in honor of the former CEO Summerfield Johnston. Last October, The Coca-Cola Company purchased the North American operations of CCE.

The scholarship program provides 100 scholarships annually to children of employees of the former North American operations of CCE. Ninety winners will receive one-time scholarships of $5,000 and 10 will receive four-year scholarships of $20,000 for a total of $650,000 in total rewards. This program is just one of several supported by The Coca-Cola Company and The Coca-Cola Foundation. For more information about the Company’s support of education, please visit http://www.thecoca-colacompany.com/citizenship/education.html

The scholars were chosen from among nearly 400 applicants. An independent judging panel reviewed every application, which includes a recommendation from a teacher, guidance counselor, or other school official, and one from an unrelated individual with whom the applicant has worked on a job or community volunteer service activity.

The Coca-Cola Company

The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE:KO) is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Led by Coca-Cola, the world's most valuable brand, the Company's portfolio features 15 billion-dollar brands including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, Powerade, Minute Maid, Simply and Georgia. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company's beverages at a rate of 1.7 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. For more information about our Company, please visit our website at www.thecoca-colacompany.com.

The Coca-Cola CompanyDora Wong, 510-219-4735dowongr@coca-cola.com

entry.headline: Visa to launch digital wallet for U.S. banks
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Visa Inc, the world's largest credit and debit card processing network, is building a digital wallet that people can use to pay for things online or with their phones instead of with traditional cards.

The network said on Wednesday it is working with several large U.S. and international banks to develop the wallet. Its partners include US Bancorp, PNC Financial Services, Regions Financial, BBT Corp, Toronto Dominion's TD Bank and the U.S. arm of Barclays PLC.

The "digital wallet" will store the banks' customers' credit and debit card account information, both for Visa cards and other cards. People can use the wallet to pay for things online or in stores, Visa said.

The network will also have to convince merchants to put a new "one-click" button on their websites, so that potential customers can use their Visa digital wallets to buy things by clicking the button instead of by manually entering all of their account information every time they want to make an online purchase.

Banks, mobile phone operators and networks like Visa are all trying to gain a foothold in the small but high-potential market for U.S. mobile payments. Last week Isis, a separate mobile payments venture run by three of the top four U.S. carriers, said it had modified its initial goals and was now open to working with Visa and MasterCard as it introduces its own mobile wallet.

Jim McCarthy, Visa's head of global products, told Reuters in an interview on Wednesday that mobile payments in the United States "will more easily take off" from people using their smartphones' browsers to buy things online.

But Visa and its rivals, including MasterCard Inc, American Express Co and Discover Financial Services, are also trying to figure out ways for people to buy things with their phones in physical stores. McCarthy said that a previous, separate Visa pilot to test smartphone payments with Bank of America Corp and other large U.S. banks will be commercially available this summer.

Visa will roll out the digital wallet in the United States and Canada in fall of 2011. McCarthy would not discuss revenue projections.

The San Francisco-based company is increasingly looking to new technology for growth, in the face of an increasing saturated U.S. credit and debit card market and tightening regulations of that market.

Visa shares were down 1.4 percent at $79.22 on Wednesday morning.

(Reporting by Maria Aspan, editing by Dave Zimmerman)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: US STOCKS-Energy stocks weigh on Wall St, Disney hurts Dow
entry.body:
* SP 500 energy sector off 2.2 percent

* Macy's gains after results, outlook

* Indexes down: Dow 0.6 pct, SP 0.5 pct, Nasdaq 0.2 pct

* For up-to-the-minute market news see [STXNEWS/US] (Updates to late morning trade, changes byline)

By Chuck Mikolajczak

NEW YORK, May 11 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks faltered on Wednesday after a three-day rally as falling crude prices hurt energy stocks and disappointing Disney earnings dragged down the Dow industrials.

The market's decline was broad, with five stocks falling for every one rising on the New York Stock Exchange. Of the 10 SP 500 sectors, only two defensive sectors -- health care and consumer staples -- were trading higher.

Energy and materials, sectors that have been laggards of late, led the decline as U.S. crude futures dropped. Concerns about slowed growth in China hit the cyclical sectors, which have teetered on worries about global demand. For details. see [O/R

"Oil prices are down and that is affecting energy stocks today," said Giri Cherukuri, head trader at OakBrook Investments in Lisle, Illinois.

The SP energy sector .GSPE dropped 2.2 percent and was the worst performing SP sector. Chevron Corp (CVX.N) was off 1.8 percent to $102.45, and Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) lost 1.5 percent to $81.61.

The Dow Jones industrial average .DJI slid 73.87 points, or 0.58 percent, to 12,686.49. The Standard Poor's 500 Index .SPX fell 6.69 points, or 0.49 percent, to 1,350.47. The Nasdaq Composite Index .IXIC shed 6.92 points, or 0.24 percent, to 2,864.97.

Before Wednesday's declines, the benchmark SP had risen 1.7 percent during the three-day run-up.

Dow component Walt Disney Co (DIS.N) tumbled 3.8 percent to $42.26 a day after its quarterly revenues missed expectations. [ID:nN10126729]

"Today, I don't think it's any big surprise (the market is down) with Disney reporting not such good numbers. Boy, they really missed it," said Terry Morris, senior equity manager for National Penn Investors Trust Company in Reading, Pennsylvania.

Among the bright spots, Macy's Inc (M.N) jumped 8.3 percent to $28.51 after its profit topped estimates. The department store chain also offered an optimistic outlook for the rest of 2011. [ID:nN09240623]

Through Wednesday, 450 of the SP 500 companies had reported, with 69 percent posting results above analysts' expectations, according to Thomson Reuters data.

American International Group Inc (AIG.N) gained 4.2 percent to $30.85 after the insurer and the U.S. Treasury said they will sell nearly $9 billion in AIG stock. [ID:nN11182986]

The latest economic report from China showed industrial output growth eased in April, suggesting the world's second-biggest economy was cooling, reducing the need for more monetary policy tightening. But Chinese inflation remained high. [ID:nL3E7GB0H2] (Reporting by Chuck Mikolajczak; editing by Jeffrey Benkoe)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Visa to Offer New Program to Directly Connect Value Added Resellers, Acquirers to Visa`s Global Network
entry.body:
Visa to Offer New Program to Directly Connect Value Added Resellers, Acquirers to Visa’s Global Network

New API network connections designed to remove barriers to innovation, enable merchants to take advantage of next generation in payments and value-added services

Visa Inc. (NYSE: V) today announced plans to offer merchants a more streamlined connection to Visa’s global network, allowing them to more easily accept the next generation of payment products, offer real-time rewards, redemptions and discounts and other value-added services.

The new program is designed to allow Value Added Resellers (VARs), Acquirers and other payment gateway providers serving merchants with payment solutions to directly connect to VisaNet, Visa’s global processing network, via a flexible XML-based API that is currently in development and expected to be available by summer 2011. This is intended to expedite the delivery of new services and offer merchants a more streamlined payment processing solution, as well as provide direct access to Visa’s secure, reliable, and information-rich processing services.

“More and more merchants are relying on the comprehensive solutions offered by value added resellers and acquirers for their payments processing needs,” said Darren Parslow, Global Head of Processing, Visa Inc. “By directly connecting these entities to Visa we can positively impact not only VARs and acquirers but also merchants and consumers. The bottom line is that Visa is working to simplify commerce across a broad range of transaction environments, including ecommerce, mobile, social commerce and point-of-sale.”

How It Works

Visa’s new program, which is expected to be available to qualified partners in the third quarter of 2011, is designed to allow VARs, Acquirers and service providers to directly connect to VisaNet through a robust, flexible, information-based API using XML. This will enable them to manage and certify to one connection for all payment types, and establish a direct communications access channel for payments and information passing through the processing hub of Visa. This can benefit VARs, acquirers and other payment providers by enabling them to offer merchants access to advanced, real-time processing services and information-based products offered by Visa.

The new program is intended to benefit VARs, acquirers and merchants in four major areas:

Simplified Processing: By reducing the number of touch points, simplifying communications between the point of sale and VisaNet, and using the latest technology standards for secure data delivery, payments and information can be processed with speed and reliability while also allowing merchants to implement new payment products and services quickly and efficiently. Innovation: The program is designed to remove barriers to innovation and help merchants accept a new generation of payments solutions that will replicate the ease, reliability and security of Visa point-of-sale payments within traditional and digital ecommerce, mobile commerce and burgeoning social networking commerce environments. For example, merchants working with VARs participating in the program will be better able to easily implement support for Visa’s secure cross-channel digital wallet, which was announced earlier today, and is expected to offer a range of customized mobile payment services that address the specific requirements of geographic markets around the world. Business Growth: For VARs the program can enhance their existing merchant relationships and enable the creation of new relationships through new value-added services made possible by the program. Visa’s new API network connections will allow merchant to integrate data into the payments process and over time offer new solutions for loyalty, discounts, rewards, recognition that may help them attract and retain customers. Acquirers can take advantage of technology investments being made by Visa and help merchant enhance relationships with their customers. Enhanced Security: Visa is also developing an end-to-end encryption solution to support PCI compliance and help protect customer data in new and emerging payment channels, such as ecommerce and mobile.

About Visa

Visa is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories to fast, secure and reliable digital currency. Underpinning digital currency is one of the world’s most advanced processing networks—VisaNet—that is capable of handling more than 20,000 transaction messages a second, with fraud protection for consumers and guaranteed payment for merchants. Visa is not a bank and does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations, however, enable its financial institution customers to offer consumers more choices: pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. For more information, visit www.corporate.visa.com.

Forward-Looking Statements

This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These statements can be identified by the terms “will,” “expected,” “intended,” “plans,” and similar references to the future. Examples of such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the timing, impact, content, reliability, acceptance, implementation and overall success of the new connections to Visa’s network and related programs. By their nature, forward-looking statements: (i) speak only as of the date they are made, (ii) are neither statements of historical fact nor guarantees of future performance and (iii) are subject to risks, uncertainties, assumptions and changes in circumstances that are difficult to predict or quantify. Therefore, actual results could differ materially and adversely from those forward-looking statements because of a variety of factors, including:

The impact of new laws, regulations and marketplace barriers, particularly those affecting, ecommerce, mobile payments, consumer privacy, and data use and security; macroeconomic factors, such as global economic, political, health environmental conditions; a decline in the growth of ecommerce and mobile payments activity; inability to keep pace with the innovations of competitors including in the ecommerce and mobile payments areas; industry and systemic developments, such as:

Competitive pressure on pricing; Bank and merchant consolidation and their increased focus on costs; Adverse changes in our relationships and reputation; Disruption of our systems or the inability to process transactions efficiently; Account data breaches and increased fraudulent and other illegal activity involving our systems; and Issues arising at Visa Europe, including failure to maintain interoperability between our systems;

and the other factors discussed under the heading "Risk Factors" in our most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K on file with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. You should not place undue reliance on such statements. Unless required to do so by law, we do not intend to update or revise any forward-looking statement because of new information or future developments or otherwise.

Press Only:Visa Inc.Matthew Flegal, +1-415-932-2564globalmedia@visa.comorFleishman-HilliardKim Coutts, +1-619-239-7723kcoutts@fleishmanhilliard.com

entry.headline: Visa to launch digital wallet for U.S. banks
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Visa Inc (V.N), the world's largest credit and debit card processing network, is building a digital wallet that people can use to pay for things online or with their phones instead of with traditional cards.

The network said on Wednesday it is working with several large U.S. and international banks to develop the wallet. Its partners include US Bancorp (USB.N), PNC Financial Services (PNC.N), Regions Financial (RF.N), BBT Corp (BBT.N), Toronto Dominion's (TD.TO) TD Bank and the U.S. arm of Barclays PLC (BARC.L).

The "digital wallet" will store the banks' customers' credit and debit card account information, both for Visa cards and other cards. People can use the wallet to pay for things online or in stores, Visa said.

The network will also have to convince merchants to put a new "one-click" button on their websites, so that potential customers can use their Visa digital wallets to buy things by clicking the button instead of by manually entering all of their account information every time they want to make an online purchase.

Banks, mobile phone operators and networks like Visa are all trying to gain a foothold in the small but high-potential market for U.S. mobile payments. Last week Isis, a separate mobile payments venture run by three of the top four U.S. carriers, said it had modified its initial goals and was now open to working with Visa and MasterCard as it introduces its own mobile wallet.

Jim McCarthy, Visa's head of global products, told Reuters in an interview on Wednesday that mobile payments in the United States "will more easily take off" from people using their smartphones' browsers to buy things online.

But Visa and its rivals, including MasterCard Inc (MA.N), American Express Co (AXP.N) and Discover Financial Services (DFS.N), are also trying to figure out ways for people to buy things with their phones in physical stores. McCarthy said that a previous, separate Visa pilot to test smartphone payments with Bank of America Corp (BAC.N) and other large U.S. banks will be commercially available this summer.

Visa will roll out the digital wallet in the United States and Canada in fall of 2011. McCarthy would not discuss revenue projections.

The San Francisco-based company is increasingly looking to new technology for growth, in the face of an increasing saturated U.S. credit and debit card market and tightening regulations of that market.

Visa shares were down 1.4 percent at $79.22 on Wednesday morning. (Reporting by Maria Aspan, editing by Dave Zimmerman)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: US STOCKS-Wall St falls, weighed by energy stocks, Disney
entry.body:
* AIG, U.S. Treasury to sell $9 bln in AIG stock

* Disney falls, Macy's gains after results

* Dow off 0.5 pct, SP down 0.4 pct, Nasdaq down 0.1 pct

* For up-to-the-minute market news see [STXNEWS/US] (Updates to mid-morning trade)

By Rodrigo Campos

NEW YORK, May 11 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks fell on Wednesday after a three-day rally as Disney results weighed on the Dow industrials and a slide in crude prices hurt energy stocks.

Dow component Walt Disney Co (DIS.N) tumbled 4.1 percent to $42.14 a day after its quarterly results missed expectations. For details, see [ID:nN10126729]

U.S. crude futures fell 2.2 percent to $101.60 per barrel, hurting energy shares. The SP 500 energy sector .GSPE slumped 2 percent and was the top drag on the index.

"Disney earnings last night were below expectations," said Giri Cherukuri, head trader at OakBrook Investments in Lisle, Illinois.

"Oil prices are down and that is affecting energy stocks today," he said. "We're getting a pullback after three days of gains in the market."

The Dow Jones industrial average .DJI dropped 65.05 points, or 0.51 percent, to 12,695.31. The Standard Poor's 500 Index .SPX fell 5.68 points, or 0.42 percent, to 1,351.48. The Nasdaq Composite Index .IXIC lost 2.29 points, or 0.08 percent, to 2,869.60.

Macy's Inc (M.N) jumped 6.1 percent to $22.95 after its profit rose more than estimated. [ID:nN09240623]

American International Group Inc (AIG.N) rose 3.5 percent to $30.62 after the insurer and the U.S. Treasury said they will sell nearly $9 billion in AIG stock, less than half of what was contemplated earlier this year. [ID:nN11182986]

The latest economic report from China showed industrial output growth eased in April, suggesting the world's second-biggest economy is cooling and reducing the need for more monetary policy tightening. But Chinese inflation remains high. [ID:nL3E7GB0H2]

In a day thin on U.S. economic indicators, the government said the trade deficit widened more than expected in March. Exports leapt to a new record, but imports rose nearly 5 percent as oil prices jumped. [ID:nN11188785] (Reporting by Rodrigo Campos; editing by Jeffrey Benkoe)

entry.headline: SafeList.com Appoints Former Microsoft VP to Advisory Board
entry.body: SAN DIEGO, CA, May 11 (MARKET WIRE) -- SafeList Ventures, Inc., parent company of San Diego-based online classifieds website, www.SafeList.com, announces the appointment of former Microsoft Corp. Vice President of Corporate Communications, Rowland Hanson, to its Advisory Board. Hanson is recognized for convincing Bill Gates to launch Microsoft's flagship product, originally called Interface Manager, under the name of Windows(TM). The Windows(TM) software went on to dominate the computer industry and became the graphical user interface of more than 90% of all personal computers sold worldwide. "I'm thrilled to welcome a marketing legend of Rowland's pedigree to our company's Advisory Board," said Karim Pirani, founder and CEO of SafeList. "As we start to rollout SafeList.com outside our San Diego home base and on to other cities nationwide, Rowland's marketing insights and acumen will be of tremendous help to us." "I'm delighted to join SafeList.com's Advisory Board," said Hanson, who is the President and CEO of The HMC Company, a business strategy and consulting firm. "For a number of years, I have been concerned about the inherent dangers plaguing the Internet and am especially passionate about working to secure the safety and security of our young children as they navigate the web. Precisely for this reason, I'm passionate about helping SafeList.com provide the solution(s) that should keep our children and their families safe from online predators." Hanson will collaborate with SafeList.com's management team on branding and marketing strategies. Also, Hanson's consulting firm will assist the company in building partnerships with other technology companies and quickly bring to market the solutions that SafeList.com offers. "Unlike commerce facilitated by websites like eBay and Amazon where the chance of a physical meeting between the buyer and the seller is almost zero, transactions facilitated by a classifieds marketplace makes it almost mandatory for the two parties to meet face-to-face," said Pirani. "Therefore the need for due diligence is more critical, not less." About SafeList.com A privately-held start-up, SafeList.com is working to make online classified advertising safer and more secure. To learn more about the Company, please visit us at www.safelist.com. Follow SafeList on Twitter @safelist. Embedded Video Available: http://www2.marketwire.com/mw/frame_mw?attachid=1607100 Contact: Ms. Lauren Magnuson SafeList Ventures, Inc. lauren.magnuson@safelist.com 858-271-7233 Copyright 2011, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Great Wolf Resorts Names Coca-Cola `Official Beverage Partner`
entry.body:
Great Wolf Resorts Names Coca-Cola ‘Official Beverage Partner’

Great Wolf Resorts, Inc.® (NASDAQ: WOLF), North America’s largest family of indoor waterpark resorts, today announced a five-year partnership with The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: KO) which makes Coca-Cola the “Official Beverage Partner” of its ten Great Wolf Lodge® locations throughout the United States. The agreement, inked earlier this year, outlines a combination of product offerings, promotions, and sponsorship opportunities designed to maximize marketing collaboration and purchasing value.

“We’re honored to have this brand-to-brand alliance with an American icon and the number one soft drink in the world,” said Tim Black, executive vice president of Great Wolf Resorts. “It’s refreshing to know that our partnership ensures that we’re not only able to anticipate our guests’ wide range of beverage needs, but also have access to the company’s breakthrough product innovation and powerful marketing capabilities.”

Coca-Cola fountain beverages are now available to Great Wolf Lodge guests in all resort restaurants, mobile distribution units and vending areas, including Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Sprite®, and Coke ZeroTM, as well as various bottled sodas, water and energy drinks. In addition, Great Wolf Resorts will pilot Coca-Cola Freestyle®: sleek, stylish, new touch screen fountain machines that offers unprecedented choice, enabling consumers to select from more than 100 regular and low-calorie branded beverages – including many varieties of waters, sports drinks, lemonades and sparkling beverages that, prior to the arrival of Coca-Cola Freestyle, were not available in the U.S. The partnership also calls for the development of various marketing and promotional programs between the two companies, including Great Wolf Resorts’ participation in the company’s “My Coke Rewards,” the world’s largest customer loyalty program.

"Coca-Cola Refreshments is excited about our new partnership with Great Wolf Resorts,” said Roy Jackson, central zone vice president for Coca-Cola. “We look forward to our long term relationship, and to providing our wide variety of beverages to their guests."

Other well-known brand products available at Great Wolf Resorts include Dunkin’ Donuts, Splashers, Enterprise Rent-A-Car, Starbucks, Pizza Hut, Nestlé USA’s Edy’s, Dreyers, and Toll House brands, National Geographic Entertainment, and Bank of America.

About Great Wolf Resorts, Inc.

Great Wolf Resorts, Inc.® (NASDAQ: WOLF), Madison, Wis., is North America’s largest family of indoor waterpark resorts, and, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, owns, licenses and/or operates its family resorts under the Great Wolf Lodge® brand. Great Wolf Resorts is a fully integrated resort company with Great Wolf Lodge locations in: Wisconsin Dells, Wis.; Sandusky, Ohio; Traverse City, Mich.; Kansas City, Kan.; Williamsburg, Va.; the Pocono Mountains, Pa.; Niagara Falls, Ontario; Mason, Ohio; Grapevine, Texas; Grand Mound, Wash.; and Concord, N.C.

The company’s resorts are family-oriented destination facilities that generally feature 300 to 600 rooms and a large indoor entertainment area measuring 40,000 to 100,000 square feet. The all-suite properties offer a variety of room styles, arcade/game rooms, fitness rooms, themed restaurants, spas, supervised children’s activities and other amenities. The company’s consolidated subsidiary, Creative Kingdoms, LLC, is a developer and operator of technology-based, interactive quest adventure experiences such as MagiQuest®.

Additional information may be found on the company’s Web site at www.greatwolf.com.

About The Coca-Cola Company

The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: KO) is the world’s largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. The Company’s portfolio includes 14 billion dollar brands, including Coca-Cola, recognized as the world’s most valuable brand, as well as Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, Powerade, Minute Maid, Simply and Georgia. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world’s largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company’s beverages at a rate of 1.7 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that protect the environment, conserve resources and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. For more information about our Company, please visit our website at www.thecoca-colacompany.com.

Great Wolf Resorts, Inc.Steve Shattuck, 608-661-4700sshattuck@greatwolf.comorCoca-Cola North AmericaScott Williamson, 404-676-3288swilliamson@na.ko.com

entry.headline: Interact 2011, Third Annual Legal and Compliance Peer-to-Peer Technology Forum, to Feature Industry Leaders from Google, Cisco, Visa, Pfizer and Tyco
entry.body:
Interact 2011, Third Annual Legal and Compliance Peer-to-Peer Technology Forum, to Feature Industry Leaders from Google, Cisco, Visa, Pfizer and Tyco

Forum to Focus on Strategies for Legal and Compliance Professionals to Achieve Agility in Today’s Changing Business Environment

Today’s corporate environment demands that every department adopt the “Do More with Less” mantra. In enterprise legal operations that means General Counsel need to effectively balance a growing portfolio of litigation, strict regulatory enforcement, growing risks and heavy penalties while being held to the same operating standards and performance metrics as any other core business unit. Chief Compliance Officers are similarly affected. A new array of regulations has been complicated by hiring freezes, layoffs, and budget cuts. The result has been predictable: more work for compliance officers and their staff with fewer available resources.

WHAT:

 

Interact 2011 is a peer-to-peer forum designed to teach legal and compliance professionals how to transform the “Do More with Less” mantra into an overall departmental strategy that delivers operational

efficiencies and positive results while maximizing profitability for their corporations. Interact 2011 is sponsored by CaseCentral, Duff Phelps, Huron Legal, Kiersted / Systems, Inc., CSC, and Mosaic Consulting.

 

WHO:

Industry leaders will join together to discuss the latest practical strategies and technologies to optimize business practices, implement and improve risk and cost management strategies, and boost performance. Attendees are also eligible to earn CLE credits.

Session topics will focus on practical strategies for managing today’s corporate legal and compliance challenges, including:

-- Knowing Your Legal Departments Value: Effectively Managing Benefits, Costs, and Risks in Operations

-- The Role of the Legal Department in Driving GRC

-- Emerging Trends - Designing an Assessable Anti-Corruption Compliance Program

-- The Profitable Legal Department

-- Assessing the GRC Capability

 

WHERE:

Fairmont Turnberry Isle 19999 West Country Club Drive Miami, FL 33180  

WHEN:

May 15-18, 2011

About Interact 2011

As the premier conference for best practices in enterprise legal and compliance management, Interact 2011 is a peer-driven educational forum. In two full days of interactive sessions, you can tap the expertise of top general counsel, chief risk compliance officers and in-house attorneys for their best insights for automating legal operations to support collaboration and accountability in equal measure.

Supported by the Association of Corporate Counsel, Council on Litigation Management, ILTA, OCEG, The Society of Corporate Compliance and Ethics, and Inside Counsel, Interact 2011 delivers expert speakers, case study sessions, panel discussions, and CLE accredited courses. The conference provides practical strategies to optimize business practices, implement and improve risk and cost management strategies, and boost performance for legal and compliance departments. Interact 2011 will be held May 15-18, 2011 at the Fairmont Turnberry Isle in Miami, FL.

Media Contacts:MitratechShirin Behnia, 323-900-1956shirin.behnia@mitratech.comorLois Paul PartnersMaribel Lopez, 781-782-5719maribel_lopez@lpp.com

entry.headline: Coca-Cola, Statue of Liberty Celebrate Shared 125th Anniversaries with $1 Million Donation from the Coca-Cola Foundation
entry.body:
Coca-Cola, Statue of Liberty Celebrate Shared 125th Anniversaries with $1 Million Donation from the Coca-Cola Foundation

Grant Supports ‘Peopling of America Center: An Ellis Island Education Initiative’

The Coca-Cola Foundation has donated $1 million to support The Statue of Liberty-Ellis Island Foundation’s Peopling of America® Center, a new initiative that will tell the story of the immigration experience in America. Muhtar Kent, Chairman and CEO of The Coca-Cola Company, made the donation Saturday night in New York to mark the shared 125th anniversaries of two American icons – Coca-Cola and the Statue of Liberty.

New York City Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg (left) accepts a rare miniature version of the Statue of Liberty as a gift to the City of New York, presented by Coca-Cola Chairman and CEO Muhtar Kent. To celebrate the shared 125th anniversaries of Coca-Cola and the Statue of Liberty, the Company made a $1 million donation in support of The Statue of Liberty-Ellis Island Foundation's Peopling of America(R) Center and gifted the 1870s-era model, created by Statue of Liberty sculptor Frederic August Bartholdi, to the City of New York. Credit: Michael Pugh / Coca-Cola

entry.headline: SanDisk to Present at the JPMorgan Technology Conference
entry.body:
SanDisk to Present at the JPMorgan Technology Conference

SanDisk Corporation (NASDAQ:SNDK), a global leader in flash memory storage solutions, today announced that Judy Bruner, Executive Vice President, Administration and Chief Financial Officer will address the investment community attending the J.P. Morgan 39th Annual Technology, Media and Telecom Conference on Tuesday, May 17, 2011 at 2:30 pm, Eastern Time. The session will be webcast and can be accessed live from SanDisk Corporation’s Investor Relations website at www.sandisk.com/IR. A replay of the webcast will also be made available.

About SanDisk

SanDisk Corporation (NASDAQ:SNDK) is a global leader in flash memory storage solutions, from research and development, product design and manufacturing to branding and distribution for OEM and retail channels. Since 1988, SanDisk’s innovations in flash memory and storage system technologies have provided customers with new and transformational digital experiences. SanDisk’s diverse product portfolio includes flash memory cards and embedded solutions used in smart phones, tablets, digital cameras, camcorders, digital media players and other consumer electronic devices, as well as USB flash drives and solid-state drives (SSD) for the computing market. SanDisk’s products are used by consumers and enterprise customers around the world.

SanDisk is a Silicon Valley-based SP 500 and Fortune 500 company. For more information, visit www.sandisk.com

SanDisk CorporationJay Iyer, 408-801-2067IR@sandisk.com
