entry.headline: Goodwin Procter Expands Securities Litigation Practice with Addition of Daniel J. Tyukody in Los Angeles
entry.body:
Goodwin Procter Expands Securities Litigation Practice with Addition of Daniel J. Tyukody in Los Angeles

Goodwin Procter LLP, a national Am Law 50 firm, announced today that Daniel J. Tyukody has joined the firm’s Litigation Department in Los Angeles as a member of its Securities Litigation White Collar Defense Practice. He will focus on all aspects of securities litigation and regulatory enforcement. Named one of the “Top 500 Lawyers in America” for the past three years by Lawdragon Magazine and one of the “Top Securities Litigators in California” by the Daily Journal, Tyukody joins Goodwin from Orrick Herrington Sutcliffe.

“Dan has exceptional depth of expertise and a proven track record in advising clients on high-profile securities litigation matters,” said Mark E. Tully, partner and chair of the firm’s Litigation Department. “He will be a key member of our Securities Litigation White Collar Defense Group, and will play a leading role in expanding our West Coast Litigation Practice.”

“We’re delighted that Dan chose to join Goodwin Procter in its Los Angeles office,” added Lewis G. Feldman, partner and LA office chair. “He’s a perfect fit for our firm. Dan possesses the judgment, skills and winning track record of a veteran best-in-class securities litigator, along with the drive and energy to continue our successful growth in California.”

Tyukody has been involved in numerous high-profile securities litigation matters resulting from the financial crisis, winning important victories for IndyMac Bancorp, Novastar Financial Corp. and Pacific Capital Bancorp. In addition, he represents a major for-profit publicly traded education company in two different securities class actions as well as related derivative cases, and a private sovereign wealth fund in matters related to the Madoff Ponzi scheme.

As lead trial counsel, Tyukody obtained a complete defense verdict in 2005 in Miller v. Thane, one of the few securities class action lawsuits tried to verdict since 1995. This case was named one of the “Top Ten Defense Verdicts” in California by the Daily Journal and was recently affirmed by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals. He has lectured and authored articles on a variety of securities topics, such as protecting companies from shareholder class actions, and the duties and responsibilities of directors and officers under the Sarbanes-Oxley and Dodd-Frank Acts.

Tyukody specializes in defending underwriters, issuers and individual officers and directors in securities class actions, derivative cases, MA cases and SEC proceedings. He counsels the audit committees or special committees of Fortune 500 companies conducting special investigations, and provides securities advice to numerous companies, including those considering or intending to go public.

Tyukody received his B.S., magna cum laude, from Duke University and his J.D. from the University of Chicago Law School where he was associate editor of The University of Chicago Law Review. He is a member of the American Bar Association, the State Bar of California and the Los Angeles County Bar Association.

He can be reached at 213.426.2627 or dtyukody@goodwinprocter.com.

Goodwin Procter has one of the largest and most active practices in the country defending securities class action, shareholder derivative, and other shareholder litigation, SEC investigations and enforcement proceedings, and related litigation and regulatory matters. The firm’s attorneys also represent corporations, officers, directors and special committees, as well as broker-dealers, private equity firms, mutual funds and other institutional investors, in a wide array of complex and transaction-based litigation and governmental investigations. Goodwin has successfully represented clients in suits and investigations brought by state Attorneys General and the U.S. Department of Justice, minority shareholder claims, contests for corporate control, alleged breach of fiduciary duties, post-closing disputes, and other complex and high-stakes matters.

About Goodwin Procter

Goodwin Procter LLP is one of the nation’s leading law firms, with offices in Boston, Hong Kong, London, Los Angeles, New York, San Diego, San Francisco, Silicon Valley and Washington, D.C. The firm provides corporate law and litigation services, with a focus on matters involving real estate, REITs and real estate capital markets; private equity; technology companies; financial services; intellectual property; products liability and mass torts; and securities litigation and white collar defense. For additional information, visit www.goodwinprocter.com. Follow us on Twitter @GoodwinProcter.

Goodwin Procter LLPLee FeldmanDirector of Communications212-459-7265leefeldman@goodwinprocter.com

entry.headline: Coca-Cola Opens Happiness with Its New "Eight-Pack" of Athletes for London 2012 Olympic Games
entry.body:
Coca-Cola Opens Happiness with Its New “Eight-Pack” of Athletes for London 2012 Olympic Games

Diverse, Talented Group of Olympians, Olympic Hopefuls and a Paralympian to Be Showcased on In-Store Materials and Serve as “Ambassadors of Active Living”

While summer 2011 is approaching, a high profile group of Olympic Champions and Olympic Hopefuls have their sights firmly set on next summer as they join forces to form the Coca-Cola “Eight-Pack” of Athletes for the London 2012 Olympic Games. In addition to their role as medal contenders for Team USA, the athletes will also serve as Coca-Cola “Ambassadors of Active Living” to help encourage and inspire people to lead active, balanced lives.

The Coca-Cola “Eight-Pack” united for the first time this week in Boston for a photo shoot. The images captured at the shoot will be featured next year on special Coca-Cola in-store materials and advertising that will invite people to share in the excitement and happiness of the Olympic Games in London. The new “Eight Pack,” a group of Olympic Champions, medalists and hopefuls, includes:

David Boudia – silver medalist in men’s platform (10M diving) at 2008 FINA Diving World Cup and winner of 14 national diving titles; 2008 U.S. Olympic Trials 10M Dive Champion; member of the 2008 Olympic Team Henry Cejudo – 2008 Olympic gold medalist in 55kg freestyle division (wrestling); youngest American wrestler ever to win an Olympic gold medal at 21 years of age Marlen Esparza – 2010 U.S. national champion in women’s boxing; gold medalist at the 2008 Pan American Games; longest winning streak at the U.S. nationals and undefeated in every U.S. event competed in the last five years; number one ranked female amateur flyweight boxer in U.S. for the last five consecutive years John Isner – currently ranked 39th in the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) standings; winner of record-breaking singles tennis match at Wimbledon which lasted for 11 hours and 5 minutes; widely recognized as having one of the hardest serves on the ATP Tour Shawn Johnson – winner of one gold and three silver medals in women’s gymnastics at the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games; member of the 2008 U.S. Olympic team; three-time gold medalist at the 2007 World Championships in All-Around, Floor, and Team; and four-time gold medalist at the 2007 Pan American Games in All-Around, Balance Beam, Floor and Team; and 2008 Olympic Trials All-American champion Jessica Long – seven-time Paralympic Gold medalist in women’s swimming; member of 2004 and 2008 U.S. Paralympic Teams; 2008 Paralympian of the Year; seven-time World Championship gold medalist and two-time silver medalist in 2010 Alex Morgan – drafted number one overall in the 2011 Women’s Professional Soccer Draft; youngest member on the U.S. Women’s National Soccer Team David Oliver – Beijing 2008 Olympic medalist in men’s 110M hurdles; member of 2008 U.S. Olympic team; 2010 Male Track Field Athlete of the Year; 2010 U.S. Outdoor Champion

This is the third consecutive Olympic Games in which Coca-Cola has included a collection of athletes as part of the brand’s Olympic program. While previous Coca-Cola Olympic Games programs have featured six athletes, this is first time the brand has highlighted eight athletes.

Shifting from a Six-Pack to an Eight-Pack of Olympic athletes is another part of Coke’s continued efforts to offer consumers new ways to experience the brands and beverages they love. Recently the Company evolved its packaging lineup to include eight-packs of 90 calorie mini-cans and a new 1.25 liter contour bottle to better meet the needs of consumers in the same way its Olympic Eight-Pack will fuel America’s passion for the Olympic Games.

Specific plans for how the “Eight-Pack” will be featured in the Coca-Cola 2012 Olympic Games program will be revealed in the future.

About The Coca-Cola Company

The Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: KO) is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Led by Coca-Cola, the world's most valuable brand, the Company's portfolio features 15 billion dollar brands including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, Powerade, Minute Maid, Simply and Georgia. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company's beverages at a rate of 1.7 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. For more information about our Company, please visit our website at www.thecoca-colacompany.com.

The Coca-Cola CompanySusan Stribling, 404-676-4120sstribling@coca-cola.com

entry.headline: SABIC y ExxonMobil Chemical adjudican contratos y celebran acuerdos tecnológicos para el nuevo proyecto de elastómeros propuesto
entry.body:
SABIC y ExxonMobil Chemical adjudican contratos y celebran acuerdos tecnológicos para el nuevo proyecto de elastómeros propuesto

Se adjudican contratos de diseño de ingeniería de etapa inicial Se firman acuerdos de licencia y tecnología seleccionada Se elige socio del campo educativo para el centro de capacitación vocacional en Yanbu

Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) y afiliadas de ExxonMobil Chemical anunciaron que se adjudicaron contratos de diseño de ingeniería de etapa inicial (front-end engineering design, FEED) y que todos los componentes se encuentran en la fase FEED para el nuevo proyecto de elastómeros propuesto en su planta petroquímica de asociación conjunta Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA).

Los contratos FEED se adjudicaron a Jacobs Engineering Inc. y a Mitsui Engineering Shipbuilding en el caso de las unidades de procesamiento, y a Fluor Transworld Services Inc. para las plantas de apoyo asociadas.

“Este proyecto de elastómeros será la base para la creación de una cadena de valor de caucho de primera clase en Arabia Saudita y una valiosa ampliación de nuestra oferta de productos y servicios a nuestros clientes en mercados clave”, comentó Koos van Haasteren, vicepresidente ejecutivo de Productos Químicos de Rendimiento de SABIC.

“Además de apoyar a la industria local, la ampliación en la asociación conjunta de KEMYA en Al-Jubail proporcionará capacidad adicional de producción de elastómeros especiales de caucho butílico y caucho de etileno propileno dieno (ethylene propylene diene monomer, EPDM) para satisfacer la creciente demanda global de estos productos”, expresó Neil Chapman, vicepresidente sénior de Polímeros de ExxonMobil Chemical Company.

Se espera que el proyecto establezca a nivel local un suministro de más de 400,000 toneladas métricas de caucho (butílico, caucho estireno butadieno [styrene butadiene rubber, SBR], caucho butadieno y EPDM), negro de carbón y polímeros especiales termoplásticos para suplir a mercados internacionales y locales emergentes de Asia y Medio Oriente.

Asimismo, el proyecto incluye el establecimiento de un centro de capacitación vocacional y desarrollo de aplicaciones de productos, además de un centro de apoyo conforme al Programa Nacional de Desarrollo de Agrupaciones Industriales (National Industrial Clusters Development Program) de Arabia Saudita para impulsar y diversificar el sector de fabricación de ese país.

Se han firmado acuerdos de licencia de terceros con Continental Carbon Company por su tecnología de producción de negro de carbón, y con The Goodyear Tire Rubber Company por su tecnología de producción de caucho polibutadieno y SBR.

La fundación University of Akron Research Foundation fue seleccionada para diseñar, apoyar y brindar instrucción en el centro de capacitación vocacional The High Institute for Elastomer Industries, en Yanbu, Arabia Saudita. El centro de capacitación utilizará la experiencia de la universidad en educación y ciencias relacionadas con los polímeros para brindar capacitación vocacional en tecnología de elastómeros para los trabajadores con el objetivo de respaldar una industria de conversión de elastómeros en una segunda etapa planificada en Arabia Saudita.

Además, un centro independiente de soporte y desarrollo de aplicaciones de productos formará parte de las nuevas instalaciones de SABIC en el complejo de investigación Riyadh Techno Valley en King Saud University.

La decisión final de implementar el proyecto de elastómeros requiere la aprobación de la Junta Directiva de KEMYA.

Acerca de ExxonMobil Chemical

ExxonMobil Chemical es una de las empresas petroquímicas más importantes del mundo, con operaciones de fabricación, tecnología y mercadeo a nivel global. La empresa ofrece una amplia cartera de productos y soluciones de manera eficiente y responsable, con el compromiso de crear un valor destacado para clientes y accionistas. ExxonMobil Chemical apoya los principios de desarrollo sostenible, incluso la necesidad de equilibrar el crecimiento económico, el desarrollo social y las consideraciones ambientales. Para obtener más información, visite www.exxonmobilchemical.com.

Los términos: “nosotros”, “nuestro”, “ExxonMobil Chemical” o “ExxonMobil” se utilizan por conveniencia y pueden incluir a ExxonMobil Chemical Company, Exxon Mobil Corporation o a cualquiera de sus afiliadas que se encuentre directa o indirectamente bajo su administración, o al conjunto de estas empresas.

Acerca de SABIC

Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) se encuentra entre las principales compañías petroquímicas del mundo. Asimismo, es líder mundial en la producción de polietileno, polipropileno y otros termoplásticos de ingeniería avanzada, glicoles, metanol y fertilizantes.

SABIC registró una ganancia neta de 21,590 millones de riyales saudíes (5,730 millones de dólares estadounidenses) en 2010. Las ganancias por ventas en 2010 alcanzaron un total de 152,000 millones de riyales saudíes (40,500 millones de dólares estadounidenses). Los activos totales representaron 317,600 millones de riyales saudíes (84,500 millones de dólares estadounidenses) al final del año 2010.

Los negocios de SABIC están agrupados en químicos, polímeros, productos químicos de rendimiento, fertilizantes, metales y plásticos de innovación. SABIC cuenta con importantes recursos de investigación que incluyen 18 plantas exclusivas de innovación y tecnología en Arabia Saudita, Estados Unidos, Países Bajos, España, India y China. La compañía opera en más de 40 países en todo el mundo y emplea a 33,000 personas.

SABIC fabrica a escala mundial en Arabia Saudita, el continente americano, Europa y Asia-Pacífico. La producción total de SABIC creció de 35 millones de toneladas métricas en 2001 a 66 millones de toneladas métricas en 2010.

Con sede en Riyadh, SABIC fue fundada en 1976 cuando el gobierno de Arabia Saudita decidió utilizar los gases de hidrocarburos asociados con su producción de petróleo como la principal materia prima para la producción de químicos, polímeros y fertilizantes. El gobierno de Arabia Saudita es propietario del 70% de las acciones de SABIC; el 30% restante pertenece a inversionistas privados de Arabia Saudita y otros países del Concejo de Cooperación del Golfo.

Notas adicionales para editores

*ExxonMobil se refiere de manera colectiva a algunas o todas las compañías afiliadas a Exxon Mobil Corporation que tienen operaciones de mercadeo o fabricación de productos químicos en todo el mundo.

*Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA) es una asociación conjunta 50 - 50 entre Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) y Exxon Chemical Arabia Inc., una afiliada de ExxonMobil Chemical.

El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. Las traducciones solo se suministran como adaptación y deben cotejarse con el texto en el idioma fuente, que es la única versión del texto que tendrá un efecto legal.

ExxonMobil ChemicalGeorge Pietrogallo, (281) 870 6607 (Houston)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: SABIC und ExxonMobil Chemical vergeben Aufträge und unterzeichnen Technologieabkommen für Elastomer-Projekt
entry.body:
SABIC und ExxonMobil Chemical vergeben Aufträge und unterzeichnen Technologieabkommen für Elastomer-Projekt

Aufträge für Front-End Engineering Design vergeben Technologie ausgewählt und Lizenzverträge abgeschlossen Ausbildungspartner für Berufsausbildungszentrum in Yanbu ausgewählt

Die Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) sowie Konzerngesellschaften von ExxonMobil Chemical haben die Vergabe von Aufträgen für Front-End Engineering Design bekannt gegeben. Alle Komponenten des in der Joint-Venture-Anlage der Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA) geplanten Elastomer-Projekts befinden sich demnach in der FEED-Phase.

FEED-Aufträge wurden an Jacobs Engineering Inc. und Mitsui Engineering Shipbuilding für Prozesseinheiten sowie an Fluor Transworld Services Inc. für zugehörige Support-Einrichtungen vergeben.

„Dieses Elastomer-Projekt bildet die Grundlage für die Schaffung einer Gummi-Wertschöpfungskette von Weltrang in Saudi-Arabien sowie für eine wertvolle Erweiterung unseres an die Kunden in Schlüsselmärkten gerichteten Produkt- und Leistungsangebots“, sagte Koos van Haasteren, Executive Vice President für Performance Chemicals, von SABIC.

„Mit dem Ausbau der KEMYA-Joint-Venture-Anlage von Al-Jubail wird nicht nur die örtliche Industrie unterstützt. Es werden außerdem zusätzliche Mengen von Butylkautschuk und EPDM- (Ethylen-Propylen-Dien-Monomer) Spezial-Elastomeren zur Stillung der wachsenden weltweiten Nachfrage nach diesen Produkten zur Verfügung gestellt“, erklärte Neil Chapman, Senior Vice President für Polymere der ExxonMobil Chemical Company.

Das Projekt soll ein inländisches Angebot von mehr als 400.000 Tonnen Gummi [Butyl, Styren-Butadien-Kautschuk (SBK), Butadien-Kautschuk und EPDM], thermoplastischen Spezial-Polymeren und Ruß für regionale und internationale Märkte in Asien und dem Nahen Osten bereitstellen.

Darüber hinaus brachte das Projekt die Errichtung eines Berufsausbildungszentrums sowie eines Zentrums für Produkt-Anwendungsentwicklung und -Support gemäß dem saudi-arabischen National Industrial Clusters Development Program zur Weiterentwicklung und Diversifizierung des Produktionssektors in Saudi-Arabien mit sich.

Externe Lizenzverträge wurden mit der Continental Carbon Company über deren Rußproduktionstechnik sowie mit der Goodyear Tire Rubber Company über deren SBR- und Polybutadien-Kautschuk-Technik abgeschlossen.

Mit der Konzeption, Schulung und Unterstützung des Berufsausbildungszentrums The High Institute for Elastomer Industries in Yanbu, Saudi-Arabien, wurde die University of Akron Research Foundation betraut. Das Ausbildungszentrum wird sich für die berufliche Ausbildung von Arbeitern das Fachwissen der Universität im Bereich Forschung und Lehre auf dem Gebiet der Polymere zunutze machen und damit die geplante nachgelagerte Elastomer-Verarbeitungsindustrie in Saudi-Arabien unterstützen.

Als Bestandteil der neuen SABIC-Anlagen im Riyadh Techno Valley-Forschungskomplex der King Saud University entsteht außerdem ein eigenes Zentrum für Produkt-Anwendungsentwicklung und -Support.

Die endgültige Entscheidung zur Umsetzung des Elastomer-Projekts bedarf der Genehmigung des KEMYA-Vorstandes.

Über ExxonMobil Chemical

ExxonMobil Chemical ist ein führendes Petrochemieunternehmen mit Produktions-, Technologie- und Vermarktungsaktivitäten auf der ganzen Welt. Das Unternehmen stellt auf effiziente und verantwortungsbewusste Weise ein breites Portfolio von Produkten und Lösungen bereit und hat sich dem Ziel verschrieben, für Kunden und Aktionäre herausragende Werte zu schaffen. ExxonMobil Chemical tritt für die Grundsätze der nachhaltigen Entwicklung ein. Hierzu zählt die Notwendigkeit, ein Gleichgewicht zwischen Wirtschaftswachstum, sozialer Entwicklung und ökologischen Gesichtspunkten herzustellen. Mehr erfahren Sie unter www.exxonmobilchemical.com.

Die Verwendung der Ausdrücke „wir“, „unser“, „ExxonMobil Chemical“ oder „ExxonMobil“ geschieht aus Gründen der Einfachheit. Hiermit können – einzeln oder kombiniert – die ExxonMobil Chemical Company, die Exxon Mobil Corporation sowie von diesen Unternehmen direkt oder indirekt kontrollierte Tochterunternehmen gemeint sein.

Über SABIC

Die Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) gehört zu den größten petrochemischen Unternehmen der Welt. Das Unternehmen ist einer der Weltmarktführer in der Fertigung von Polyethylen, Polypropylen und anderen Hochleistungs-Thermoplasten, Glykolen, Methanol und Düngemitteln.

Im Jahr 2010 verzeichnete SABIC einen Nettogewinn in Höhe von 21,5 Milliarden Saudischer Rial (5,73 Milliarden US-Dollar) und einen Gesamtumsatzerlös von 152 Milliarden Saudischer Rial (40,5 Milliarden US-Dollar). Das Gesamtvermögen wurde Ende 2010 auf 317,6 Milliarden Saudischer Rial (84,5 Milliarden US-Dollar) beziffert.

Die Geschäftsbereiche von SABIC sind unterteilt in Chemikalien, Polymere, Performance-Chemikalien, Düngemittel, Metalle und innovative Kunststoffe. SABIC verfügt über bedeutende Forschungsressourcen und 18 spezielle Zentren für Technologie und Innovation in Saudi-Arabien, den USA, den Niederlanden, Spanien, Japan, Indien und China. Das Unternehmen ist weltweit in mehr als 40 Ländern tätig und beschäftigt über 33.000 Mitarbeiter auf der ganzen Welt.

SABIC produziert im weltweiten Maßstab in Saudi-Arabien, Nord- und Südamerika, Europa sowie im asiatisch-pazifischen Raum. Die Gesamtproduktion von SABIC ist von 35 Millionen Tonnen im Jahr 2001 auf 66 Millionen Tonnen im Jahr 2010 gestiegen.

Das in Riad ansässige Unternehmen wurde im Jahr 1976 gegründet, als die saudi-arabische Regierung beschloss, die bei seiner Ölproduktion entstehenden Kohlenwasserstoffgase als Hauptrohmaterial für die Herstellung von Chemikalien, Polymeren und Düngemitteln einzusetzen. Der saudi-arabische Staat hält 70 Prozent der Aktien von SABIC. Die restlichen 30 Prozent gehören privaten Anlegern in Saudi-Arabien und anderen Ländern des Golfkooperationsrats.

Zusätzliche Hinweise für die Presse

*ExxonMobil bezieht sich auf einige oder alle mit der Exxon Mobil Corporation verbundene Unternehmen, die Betriebe zur Herstellung und/oder zum Absatz von Chemikalien auf der ganzen Welt unterhalten.

*Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA) ist ein 50:50 Joint Venture zwischen der Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) und Exxon Chemical Arabia Inc., einem Tochterunternehmen von ExxonMobil Chemical.

Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. Übersetzungen werden zur besseren Verständigung mitgeliefert. Nur die Sprachversion, die im Original veröffentlicht wurde, ist rechtsgültig. Gleichen Sie deshalb Übersetzungen mit der originalen Sprachversion der Veröffentlichung ab.

ExxonMobil ChemicalGeorge Pietrogallo, (281) 870 6607 (Houston)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: SABIC et ExxonMobil Chemical attribuent des contrats et signent des accords technologiques pour le projet de fabrication de nouveaux élastomères
entry.body:
SABIC et ExxonMobil Chemical attribuent des contrats et signent des accords technologiques pour le projet de fabrication de nouveaux élastomères

Les contrats d'ingénierie initiale sont attribués La technologie est sélectionnée et les accords de licence signés Un partenaire éducatif est sélectionné pour le centre de formation professionnelle de Yanbu

La société Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) et des filiales d'ExxonMobil Chemical ont annoncé que des contrats d'ingénierie initiale (FEED pour Front-End Engineering Design) ont été attribués et que tous les composants sont en phase initiale pour le projet de fabrication de nouveaux élastomères développé par la coentreprise pétrochimique KEMYA d'Al-Jubail.

Des contrats FEED ont été attribués à Jacobs Engineering Inc. et à Mitsui Engineering Shipbuilding pour les unités de traitement ainsi qu'à Fluor Transworld Services Inc. pour les installations de soutien connexes.

« Ce projet de fabrication d'élastomères servira de fondement à la création d'une chaîne d'exploitation du caoutchouc de classe internationale en Arabie Saoudite. Ce projet va fortement renforcer notre offre de produits et de services à nos clients dans des marchés clés », a déclaré Koos van Haasteren, vice-président exécutif de Performance Chemicals chez SABIC.

« En plus d'appuyer l'industrie locale, l'expansion de la coentreprise KEMYA à Al-Jubail offrirait de nouvelles capacités supplémentaires de caoutchouc butyle et d'élastomères EPDM (éthylène-propylène-diène monomère) spécialisés afin de répondre à la demande mondiale croissante pour ces produits », a déclaré Neil Chapman, vice-président général des polymères chez ExxonMobil Chemical.

Le projet devrait établir une offre intérieure de plus de 400 000 tonnes métriques de caoutchouc [caoutchouc butyle, styrène butadiène (SBR), butadiène et EPDM], des polymères de spécialité thermoplastique et noir carbone pour alimenter les marchés émergents locaux et internationaux d'Asie et du Moyen-Orient.

Le projet prévoit aussi la création d'un centre de formation professionnelle et de développement d'applications de produits ainsi qu'un centre de soutien aligné sur le programme national saoudien de développement d'ensembles industriels afin de renforcer et diversifier le secteur manufacturier en Arabie Saoudite.

Des accords de licence de tiers ont été signés avec Continental Carbon Company pour sa technologie de production de noir de carbone et avec The Goodyear Tire Rubber Company pour sa technologie de caoutchouc SBR et polybutadiène.

La fondation de la recherche de l'Université d'Akron a été sélectionnée pour concevoir, former et soutenir « The High Institute for Elastomer Industries », le centre de formation professionnelle de Yanbu en Arabie Saoudite. Le centre de formation va utiliser l'expertise de l'Université en matière de connaissances sur les polymères pour assurer des formations technologiques professionnelles destinées aux travailleurs et pour soutenir en aval une industrie de conversion des matériaux élastomères en Arabie Saoudite.

En outre, un centre séparé de développement d'applications de produits et d'assistance fera partie des nouvelles installations de SABIC dans le complexe de recherche Riyad Techno Valley à l'Université du Roi Saoud.

La décision finale de mise en œuvre du projet élastomères requiert l'approbation du Conseil d'administration de KEMYA.

À propos d'ExxonMobil Chemical

ExxonMobil Chemical, une des plus importantes sociétés pétrochimiques internationales, dispose d'installations de fabrication, de technologie et d'opérations de marketing dans le monde entier. La société propose, de manière efficace et responsable, un large éventail de produits et de solutions. Elle s'engage par ailleurs à offrir un service clientèle exceptionnel et à créer de la valeur actionnariale. ExxonMobil Chemical fait siens les principes du développement durable, y compris la nécessité d'équilibrer la croissance économique, le développement social et les considérations environnementales. Pour en savoir plus, consultez le site www.exxonmobilchemical.com .

Les termes « nous », « notre », « ExxonMobil Chemical », ou « ExxonMobil » sont utilisés pour plus de commodité et peuvent inclure une ou plusieurs des sociétés ExxonMobil Chemical Company, Exxon Mobil Corporation, ou une filiale que ces sociétés gèrent directement ou indirectement.

À propos de SABIC

Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) se classe parmi les sociétés pétrochimiques internationales de premier plan. La société est l'un des leaders du marché mondial dans la production de polyéthylène, de polypropylène et d'autres thermoplastiques de pointe, glycols, méthanol et engrais.

SABIC a déclaré un bénéfice net de 21,59 milliards SAR (5,73 milliards USD) en 2010. Le chiffre d'affaires pour 2010 s'élève à 152 milliards SAR (40,5 milliards USD). Le total de l'actif atteint 317,6 milliards SAR (84,5 milliards USD) à la fin de 2010.

Les activités de SABIC sont regroupées en substances chimiques, polymères, produits chimiques de performance, engrais, métaux et matières plastiques innovantes. SABIC dispose d'importantes ressources en matière de recherches avec 18 installations vouées à la technologie et à l'innovation en Arabie Saoudite, aux États-Unis, aux Pays-Bas, en Espagne, en Inde et en Chine. La société opère dans plus de 40 pays à travers le monde avec un effectif international de 33 000 employés.

SABIC fabrique à l'échelle mondiale en Arabie Saoudite, dans les Amériques, en Europe et en Asie-Pacifique. La production globale de SABIC a augmenté, passant de 35 millions de tonnes métriques en 2001 à 66 millions de tonnes métriques en 2010.

Basée à Riyadh, SABIC a été fondée en 1976 lorsque le gouvernement saoudien a décidé d'utiliser les gaz d'hydrocarbures associés à sa production de pétrole comme matière première principale pour la production de produits chimiques, de polymères et d'engrais. Le gouvernement saoudien détient 70 % des parts de SABIC, 30 % des parts restantes étant détenues par des investisseurs privés en Arabie Saoudite et dans d'autres pays du Conseil de coopération du Golfe.

Notes complémentaires aux rédacteurs en chef

*ExxonMobil renvoie collectivement à certaines ou à toutes les sociétés affiliées à Exxon Mobil Corporation, qui ont des usines de fabrication de produits chimiques et/ou des opérations de marketing dans le monde entier.

*Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA) est une coentreprise 50-50 des sociétés Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) et Exxon Chemical Arabia Inc., une filiale d'ExxonMobil Chemical.

Le texte du communiqué issu d’une traduction ne doit d’aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d’origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence.

ExxonMobil ChemicalGeorge Pietrogallo, (281) 870 6607 (Houston)

entry.headline: SABIC e ExxonMobil Chemical celebram contratos e assinam acordos tecnológicos para projeto de novos elastômeros proposto
entry.body:
SABIC e ExxonMobil Chemical celebram contratos e assinam acordos tecnológicos para projeto de novos elastômeros proposto

Celebrados contratos com a Front-End Engineering Design Tecnologia selecionada e acordos de licenciamento assinados Parceiros educativos selecionados para o centro de formação profissional em Yanbu

A Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) e afiliadas da ExxonMobil Chemical anunciaram que foram celebrados contratos com a Front-End Engineering Design e que todos os componentes estão na fase FEED para o projeto de novos elastômeros proposto na sua planta petroquímica de joint-venture Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA).

Contratos FEED foram celebrados com a Jacobs Engineering Inc. e Mitsui Engineering Shipbuilding para unidades de processamento e com a Fluor Transworld Services Inc. para instalações de suporte associadas.

“Este projeto de elastômeros será a base para a criação de uma cadeia de valor de borracha de nível mundial na Arábia Saudita e uma valiosa extensão da nossa oferta de produtos e serviços aos nossos clientes nos mercados principais”, disse Koos van Haasteren, vice-presidente executivo da SABIC, Performance Chemicals.

“Além de apoiar a indústria local, a expansão da joint-venture KEMYA em Al-Jubail proporcionaria novas capacidades adicionais de borracha butílica e elastômeros especiais EPDM (etileno propileno-dieno monômero) para atender à crescente demanda mundial por esses produtos”, disse Neil Chapman, vice-presidente sênior, Polímeros, ExxonMobil Chemical Company.

O projeto deverá estabelecer um abastecimento interno de mais de 400 mil toneladas métricas de borracha [butila, co-polímero de estireno e butadieno (SBR), borracha de butadieno e EPDM], polímeros especiais termoplásticos e negro de carbono para atender aos mercados emergentes local e internacional na Ásia e no Oriente Médio.

O projeto também inclui a criação de um centro de formação profissional, desenvolvimento de aplicações para o produto e uma central de suporte alinhados com o programa nacional de desenvolvimento de conglomerados industriais da Arábia Saudita para estimular o crescimento e a diversificação da indústria de manufatura na Arábia Saudita.

Acordos de licença de terceiros foram assinados com a Continental Carbon Company para a tecnologia de produção de negro de carbono e com o Goodyear Tire Rubber Company para a tecnologia de borracha SBR e polibutadieno.

A Fundação de Pesquisas da Universidade de Akron foi selecionada para projetar, treinar e dar suporte ao centro de formação profissional, The High Institute for Elastomer Industries, em Yanbu, Arábia Saudita. O centro de formação irá usar o conhecimento técnico da universidade em ciência de polímeros e em educação para fornecer formação profissional em tecnologia de elastômeros para apoiar uma futura indústria planejada de conversão de elastômeros na Arábia Saudita.

Além disso, uma central independente de desenvolvimento de aplicações para o produto e de suporte fará parte das novas instalações da SABIC no complexo de pesquisas do Vale Tecnológico de Riade, na Universidade Rei Saud.

A decisão final para implantar o projeto de elastômeros requer a aprovação do conselho de administração da KEMYA.

Sobre a ExxonMobil Chemical

A ExxonMobil Chemical é uma das principais empresas petroquímicas do mundo, com operações de manufatura, tecnologia e marketing em todo o mundo. A empresa oferece um amplo portfólio de produtos e soluções de forma eficiente e responsável, com o compromisso de agregar valor significativo a clientes e acionistas. A ExxonMobil Chemical endossa os princípios do desenvolvimento sustentável, incluindo a necessidade de equilibrar crescimento econômico, desenvolvimento social e questões ambientais. Para saber mais, visite www.exxonmobilchemical.com.

Os termos “nós”, “nosso”, “ExxonMobil Chemical” ou “ExxonMobil” são usados por conveniência e podem incluir uma ou mais ExxonMobil Chemical Company, Exxon Mobil Corporation ou qualquer afiliada administrada direta ou indiretamente.

Sobre a SABIC

A Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) está entre as principais empresas petroquímicas do mundo. A empresa está entre os líderes mundiais nos mercados de produção de polietileno, polipropileno e outros termoplásticos avançados, glicóis, metanol e fertilizantes.

A SABIC registrou um lucro líquido de 21,59 bilhões de riais sauditas (US$ 5,73 bilhões) em 2010. As receitas de vendas de 2010 totalizaram 152 bilhões de riais sauditas (US$ 40,5 bilhões). Os ativos totais atingiram 317,6 bilhões de riais sauditas (US$ 84,5 bilhões) ao final de 2010.

Os negócios da SABIC são agrupados em produtos químicos, polímeros, produtos químicos de alto desempenho, fertilizantes, metais e plásticos inovadores. A SABIC tem recursos de pesquisa significativos, com 18 instalações de Tecnologia Inovação dedicadas na Arábia Saudita, nos Estados Unidos, Holanda, Espanha, Índia e China. A empresa opera em mais de 40 países, com 33 mil funcionários no mundo inteiro.

A SABIC fabrica em escala global, na Arábia Saudita, Américas, Europa e Ásia-Pacífico. A produção geral da SABIC aumentou de 35 milhões de toneladas em 2001 para 66 milhões de toneladas métricas em 2010.

Com sede em Riade, a SABIC foi fundada em 1976, quando o governo da Arábia Saudita decidiu usar gases de hidrocarbonetos associados à produção de petróleo como principal matéria-prima para a produção de produtos químicos, polímeros e fertilizantes. O governo da Arábia Saudita detém 70% das ações da SABIC, com os 30% restantes pertencendo a investidores particulares da Arábia Saudita e de outros países do Conselho de Cooperação do Golfo.

Notas adicionais aos editores

*ExxonMobil refere-se coletivamente a algumas ou a todas as empresas afiliadas à Exxon Mobil Corporation, que têm fabricação de produtos químicos e/ou operações de marketing em todo o mundo.

*Al-Jubail Petrochemical Company (KEMYA) é uma joint-venture 50-50 entre a Saudi Basic Industries Corporation (SABIC) e a Exxon Chemical Arabia Inc., uma afiliada da ExxonMobil Chemical.

O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal.

ExxonMobil ChemicalGeorge Pietrogallo, (281) 870 6607 (Houston)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Pfizer's Anti-TNF-Alpha Nanobody (ATN-103) Successfully Completes a Phase II Study and Demonstrates Clinical
entry.body: GHENT, BELGIUM, May 17 (MARKET WIRE) -- REGULATED INFORMATION GHENT, Belgium, 17 May 2011 - Ablynx [Euronext Brussels: ABLX] today announced top-line results from the recently completed POC Phase II clinical trial of ozoralizumab (ATN-103), an anti-TNF-alpha Nanobody licensed to Pfizer, in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The study evaluated five different dosing groups plus placebo, and preliminary analysis of the data indicates that the study met its pre-defined primary efficacy endpoint with the highest dose of ozoralizumab (80 mg every 4 weeks) resulting in a statistically significant improvement of ACR20 responses compared with placebo at week 16. In addition, an improvement over placebo was also observed for secondary endpoints such as improvements of clinical scores, DAS28, ACR50, ACR70 and EULAR response at this dose level at week 16. No dose limiting toxicities were observed, and the adverse events and serious adverse events that did occur, did not show a clinically significant increase on increased dosing. Pfizer have now confirmed that clinical proof-of-concept has been achieved and they are now engaged in a full technical, clinical and commercial evaluation to determine whether and how to take ATN-103 forward. Dr Edwin Moses, Chairman and CEO commented: "We are delighted to announce the first clinical proof-of-concept for a Nanobody. This has extremely important implications for Ablynx, the whole Nanobody technology platform and our R pipeline containing more than 25 programmes. Our progress has been rapid and we are excited to have passed this critical milestone in our development into a potentially leading biopharmaceutical company. We look forward to the completion of Pfizer's internal decision making process." About the clinical development programme Pfizer successfully completed Phase I studies with ATN-103 in the summer of 2009, and then initiated two randomized, double-blind Phase II trials in Japan, US and Rest of the World in September 2009, which finished recruitment of a total of 312 patients in September 2010. Complete version of the press release: http://hugin.info/137912/R/1516627/452958.pdf This announcement is distributed by Thomson Reuters on behalf of Thomson Reuters clients. The owner of this announcement warrants that: (i) the releases contained herein are protected by copyright and other applicable laws; and (ii) they are solely responsible for the content, accuracy and originality of the information contained therein. Source: Ablynx via Thomson Reuters ONE [HUG#1516627] For more information, please contact Ablynx: Dr Edwin Moses Chairman and CEO t: +32 (0)9 262 00 07 m: +44 (0)7771 954 193 / +32 (0)473 39 50 68 e: edwin.moses@ablynx.com Marieke Vermeersch Investor Relations Manager t: +32 (0)9 262 00 82 m: +32 (0)479 49 06 03 e: marieke.vermeersch@ablynx.com Copyright 2011, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: PFIZER'S ANTI-TNF-ALPHA NANOBODY (ATN-103) SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES A PHASE II STUDY AND DEMONSTRATES CLINICAL PROOF-OF-CONCEPT (POC) IN PATIENTS WITH RA
entry.body:
REGULATED INFORMATION

GHENT, Belgium, 17 May 2011 - Ablynx [Euronext Brussels: ABLX] today announced top-line results from the recently completed POC Phase II clinical trial of ozoralizumab (ATN-103), an anti-TNF-alpha Nanobody licensed to Pfizer, in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The study evaluated five different dosing groups plus placebo, and preliminary analysis of the data indicates that the study met its pre-defined primary efficacy endpoint with the highest dose of ozoralizumab (80 mg every 4 weeks) resulting in a statistically significant improvement of ACR20 responses compared with placebo at week 16. In addition, an improvement over placebo was also observed for secondary endpoints such as improvements of clinical scores, DAS28, ACR50, ACR70 and EULAR response at this dose level at week 16. No dose limiting toxicities were observed, and the adverse events and serious adverse events that did occur, did not show a clinically significant increase on increased dosing.

 

Pfizer have now confirmed that clinical proof-of-concept has been achieved and they are now engaged in a full technical, clinical and commercial evaluation to determine whether and how to take ATN-103 forward.

 

Dr Edwin Moses, Chairman and CEO commented: "We are delighted to announce the first clinical proof-of-concept for a Nanobody. This has extremely important implications for Ablynx, the whole Nanobody technology platform and our RD pipeline containing more than 25 programmes. Our progress has been rapid and we are excited to have passed this critical milestone in our development into a potentially leading biopharmaceutical company. We look forward to the completion of Pfizer's internal decision making process."

 

About the clinical development programmePfizer successfully completed Phase I studies with ATN-103 in the summer of 2009, and then initiated two randomized, double-blind Phase II trials in Japan, US and Rest of the World in September 2009, which finished recruitment of a total of 312 patients in September 2010.

 

For more information, please contact Ablynx:Dr Edwin MosesChairman and CEO t:   +32 (0)9 262 00 07m: +44 (0)7771 954 193 /      +32 (0)473 39 50 68e:  edwin.moses@ablynx.com

entry.headline: Nancy Waltermire Named Chief Compliance Officer at Aveta Inc.
entry.body:
Nancy Waltermire Named Chief Compliance Officer at Aveta Inc.

Industry Veteran to Lead Compliance Efforts

Aveta Inc., one of the nation’s largest providers of managed healthcare services, announced today the addition of Nancy Waltermire as chief compliance officer.

Waltermire’s primary responsibility will be overseeing and managing compliance issues within Aveta. In this role, Waltermire will work to ensure that Aveta is complying with regulatory requirements and that all company employees are complying with internal policies and procedures. Waltermire will report to Aveta president and CEO, Dr. Richard Shinto.

“As the heavily regulated healthcare industry continues to evolve, compliance issues will remain a top priority,” said Richard Shinto, M.D., president and CEO of Aveta. “Nancy’s expertise will be a valuable asset for Aveta.”

Waltermire has a strong background in healthcare compliance. Most recently, she was in the compliance area at Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey in Newark. In that role, she managed the Medicare Prescription Drug Plan Contract with CMS and provided regulatory support to all areas of operations within the plan. Prior to that, Waltermire was the manager of Medicare operations/compliance at AmeriChoice Health Services in Newark and was the government contracts administrator at HIP Health Plan of New Jersey in North Brunswick.

“For years, I’ve worked closely with regulatory agencies,” said Waltermire. “I look forward to this new opportunity and ensuring that Aveta meets all current and future compliance regulations.”

Waltermire has been a speaker at the HMO Group Annual Medicaid Managed Care Conference and at the AAHP Annual Managed Care Conference. She is also active with many industry groups such as the Human Services Managed Care Task Force and the Human Services DYFS Mandated Managed Care Committee, among others. She is currently a member of the Delaware Valley Chapter Scleroderma Foundation Board of Directors. Waltermire attended Middlesex County College and Raritan Valley Community College. She has earned certifications in ICD 9 Coding, CPT 4 Coding, Medical Terminology, Hospital Contracting and Total Quality Management.

About Aveta Inc.

One of the largest providers of managed healthcare services in the United States, Aveta Inc. is redefining healthcare management to meet the challenges of today’s complex healthcare environment. Developing innovative models that coordinate care for more than 230,000 Medicare beneficiaries and more than 300,000 commercial members, Aveta builds provider networks and Medicare Advantage programs that are sustainable, cost-effective and utilize advanced technologies. The company is headquartered in Fort Lee, New Jersey, and currently has operating subsidiaries in California, Illinois, Arizona and Puerto Rico. For more information, visit www.aveta.com.

For Aveta Inc.Emily Ayres, 615-254-0575

entry.headline: Fitch Issues Presale on J.P. Morgan Chase 2011-C4 Commercial Mortgage Pass-Through Certificates
entry.body:
Fitch Issues Presale on J.P. Morgan Chase 2011-C4 Commercial Mortgage Pass-Through Certificates

Link to Fitch Ratings' Report: J.P. Morgan Chase Commercial Mortgage Securities Trust 2011-C4 (US CMBS)http://www.fitchratings.com/creditdesk/reports/report_frame.cfm?rpt_id=630289

Fitch Ratings has issued a presale report on JP Morgan Chase Commercial Mortgage Securities Corp. 2011-C4.

Fitch expects to rate the transaction and assign Loss Severity (LS) ratings and Outlooks as follows:

--$77,861,000 class A-1 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$336,403,000 class A-2 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$353,150,000 class A-3 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$125,000,000 class A-3FL 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$61,976,000 class A-SB 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$226,811,000 class A-4 'AAAsf/LS1'; Outlook Stable;

--$1,181,201,000* class X-A 'AAAsf'; Outlook Stable.

*Notional amount and interest only.

The expected ratings are based on information provided by the issuer as of May 13, 2011. Fitch does not expect to rate the B, C, D, E, F, G, H, NR or X-B classes.

The certificates represent the beneficial ownership in the trust, primary assets of which are 42 loans secured by 84 commercial properties having an aggregate principal balance of approximately $1.45 billion as of the cutoff date. The loans were originated by JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.

Fitch reviewed a comprehensive sample of the transaction's collateral, including site inspections on 81.1% of the properties by balance, cash flow analysis of 89.4% of the pool, and asset summary reviews on 91.9% of the pool.

The transaction has a Fitch stressed debt service coverage ratio (DSCR) of 1.28 times (x), a Fitch stressed loan-to value (LTV) of 86.7%, and a Fitch debt yield of 10.2%. Fitch's aggregate net cash flow represents a variance of 6.2% to issuer cash flows and 6.2% below full-year 2010 net operating income.

The transaction is concentrated by loan size. The largest 10 loans account for 68.8% of the pool. The largest sponsor is a joint venture between the LeFrak and Simon families, with a loan accounting for 13.8% of the pool.

The Master Servicer will be Midland Loan Services, Inc., a Division of PNC Bank, N.A., rated 'CMS1' by Fitch. The Special Servicer will be Torchlight Loan Services, LLC, rated 'CSS2' by Fitch.

The presale report is available at 'www.fitchratings.com'.

Additional information is available at 'www.fitchratings.com'.

--'U.S. Commercial Mortgage Originator Review Criteria' dated April 24, 2009;

entry.headline: New Software Titles From Sams Publishing and Addison-Wesley Professional To Be Announced at Microsoft TechEd 2011
entry.body:
New Software Titles From Sams Publishing and Addison-Wesley Professional To Be Announced at Microsoft TechEd 2011

Formats Include eBooks, Rough Cuts, Video Training, and Print

Addison-Wesley Professional and Sams Publishing today announced new titles focused on SharePoint, Windows Phone, and Visual Studio, created for Microsoft IT professionals and developers. The announcement was made at Microsoft TechEd 2011, taking place May 16-19 in Atlanta, GA.

NEWS FACTS

New books available in both print and eBook formats include Designing Forms for SharePoint and Infopath by Scott Roberts, Hagen Green, and Jessica Meats; SharePoint 2010 Business Intelligence Unleashed, by Steven Mann, Chuck Rivel, Ray Barley, Jim Pletscher, and Aneel Ismaily; and 101 Windows Phone 7 Apps, Volume I, by Adam Nathan. Rough Cuts (early access to an author’s developing manuscript) being announced include Essential Windows Phone 7, by Shawn Wildermuth; SharePoint 2010 Development with Silverlight, by Bob German and Paul Stubbs; Agile Software Engineering with Visual Studio, by Sam Guckenheimer and Neno Loje; and Programming Data, by Chris Sells. New Video Training announced at the show Windows Phone 7 Programming LiveLessons (Video Training) by Kevin Wolf. Save up to 50% on LiveLessons Entire-Course Downloads and DVDs at informit.com.

Titles are available for purchase at the convention bookstore and for browsing at the Sams Publishing/Addison-Wesley Professional booth #1919. Throughout the week, attendees can enter daily drawings to win free products. For those unable to make the show, visit www.informit.com/teched for more information on our latest products as well as enter to win a library of new Microsoft books.

About Pearson

Pearson (NYSE: PSO), the education, services, and technology company, is home to such respected brands as Addison-Wesley Professional, Cisco Press, Exam Cram, IBM Press, Prentice Hall Professional, Que, and Sams Publishing, which have as their online publishing arm, InformIT (www.informit.com) -The Trusted Technology Learning Source. In addition, Berkeley-based Peachpit (www.peachpit.com), the publishing partner for Adobe Press, Apple Certified, and others, publishes best-selling books for creative design professionals. Pearson is also co-founder, with O'Reilly Media Inc., of Safari Books Online (http://safari.informit.com), the premier on-demand technology content library providing thousands of expert reference materials through a single point of contact, including expert technology, creative and design, industry and management resources in video, audio and written formats. Pearson's other primary businesses include the Financial Times Group and the Penguin Group.

Photos/Multimedia Gallery Available: http://www.businesswire.com/cgi-bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6727109lang=en

entry.headline: Aspect Contact 2011 Now Generally Available for Small to Mid-Sized Contact Centers and Help Desks Deploying Microsoft
entry.body: CHELMSFORD, MA, May 17 (MARKET WIRE) -- Aspect, a leading provider of customer contact and Microsoft platform solutions, today announced the general availability of Aspect(R) Contact(TM) 2011, a solution designed to deliver essential customer contact capabilities for small to mid-sized contact centers and IT, HR, travel or other help desks operating with 20 - 100 seats. Built to use Microsoft Lync 2010 as its media server, Aspect Contact 2011 enables organizations to achieve an additional level of productivity and a quicker ROI from their Lync deployments. Aspect Contact 2011 leverages a subset of core functionality from its enterprise-class Aspect(R) Unified IP(R) to provide voice, instant message (IM) and email routing, as well as real-time and historical reporting for enterprises with smaller contact center or help desk operations. Packaged as an appliance, its powerful out-of-the-box capabilities allow Microsoft-centric businesses to effectively use their unified communications and collaboration deployments within their contact centers or help desks to deliver improved service levels. Market research firm, Ovum, reports that small- to mid-size contact centers of 100 seats or less comprise 85 percent of the global contact center market. Aspect's expansion into the small- to mid-size contact center market is a natural progression, given its market leadership and vast expertise in the enterprise contact center category, its partnership with equity investor, Microsoft Corp. and in-depth experience with Lync. With this roll out, Aspect is now fully capable to address the needs of any size contact center. The broad feature set available in Aspect Contact 2011 helps organizations optimize productivity across all stages of an interaction whether in a help desk or small contact center environment. Intelligent routing ensures that customers are serviced by best-skilled resources, and a comprehensive agent desktop provides enriched information presentation and streamlined screen pops. Structured workflows and centralized administration and reporting help to identify and address performance issues, enabling faster issue resolution and better agent performance and satisfaction. The solution is pre-configured with standard options, allowing organizations to deploy and be operational within a few hours using their own IT resources or remote services from Aspect. Aspect Contact 2011 is easy to use and maintain, requires very little training, delivers a fully integrated, robust agent desktop, and its intuitive user interface is designed to be quickly and easily grasped by Lync users. Features and Functionality Aspect Contact offers: -- Seamless multi-channel routing -- A robust agent desktop -- Expert search to identify subject matter experts in the contact center and enterprise -- Ask an Expert functionality to enable single-click interaction with experts via IM or phone to address the client inquiry on the first contact -- Centralized administration and reporting -- Support for at-home and remote agents Aspect Contact is ideal for help desks or contact centers wanting to: -- Better handle/route incoming service requests -- Proactively train end users in an effort to reduce future support requirements -- Enhance operational efficiency through automated workflows, administration and reporting -- Increase first contact resolutions utilizing skilled-based presence, expert search, remote desktop access and conferencing -- Maximize the return on Lync investments -- Deploy quickly without additional IT resources -- Leverage capabilities with little to no training -- Incorporate more sophisticated unified communications and contact center capabilities at an attractive price point Availability Aspect Contact 2011 is currently being sold directly by Aspect with initial availability in the English language in North America, the UK, Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia. The solution delivers powerful options for contact handling at a price point aligned with small- to mid-sized operations. To learn more about Aspect Contact 2011 please visit http://www.aspect.com/Pages/Products/Aspect-Contact-2011.aspx. View a video overview of what the solution provides, a video that demonstrates the user interface and some of the functionality or download a screenshot. Quotes on Aspect Contact 2011: Ian Jacobs, senior analyst, Ovum -- "Aspect Contact 2011 aims to create a more level playing field for companies with smaller contact centers or help desk applications that want to automate improvements in the services and user experience they deliver. Aspect understands that these smaller organizations need a feature-rich contact center solution bolstered by the latest unified communications capabilities without being cost prohibitive." Kirk Gregersen, senior director, Microsoft Corp -- "Aspect Contact 2011 provides many benefits to Microsoft customers with small- to mid-sized contact centers and help desks, providing them with additional capabilities for efficiency and improved customer experience. It allows organizations to maximize their investments in unified communications. As part of our ongoing partnership, Aspect has optimized both Aspect Contact 2011 and the enterprise-level Aspect Unified IP platform for use with Microsoft technologies." Mike Ely, vice president technology, Aspect -- "Aspect has filled a void in the internal help desk and small- to mid-sized contact center market with Aspect Contact 2011 by combining our robust contact center capabilities with Microsoft's unified communications and collaboration to deliver a powerful, effective, easy-to-deploy, cost-effective solution. As a pioneer in the contact center industry with decades of product and market leadership, Aspect is uniquely positioned to provide an innovative, unified communications-based solution that enables companies with smaller operations to improve productivity, drive efficiencies and deliver enriched customer experiences that increase customer satisfaction, loyalty and retention." About Aspect Aspect builds customer relationships through a combination of customer contact software and Microsoft platform services/solutions. For more information, visit www.aspect.com. Follow Aspect on Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/AspectUC. Read our blogs at http://blogs.aspect.com. Aspect, Unified IP, Contact and Aspect Software are either trademarks or registered trademarks of Aspect Software, Inc., in the United States and/or other countries. The names of other companies and products mentioned herein may be the trademarks of their respective owners. Embedded Video Available: http://www2.marketwire.com/mw/frame_mw?attachid=1614391 Image Available: http://www2.marketwire.com/mw/frame_mw?attachid=1614402 Anastasia Bullinger +1 630 227 8108 anastasia.bullinger@aspect.com Copyright 2011, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Ensim Corporation Renews Gold Certified Partner Status in Microsoft Partner Program
entry.body: SANTA CLARA, CA, May 17 (MARKET WIRE) -- Ensim Corporation, the leading provider of provisioning and IDM automation management for Enterprises and Service Providers, today announced it has renewed its Gold Certified Partner status in the Microsoft Partner Program in the critical, customer-required ISV/Software Solutions competency for the fifth consecutive year. As a Gold Certified Partner, Ensim maintains its position at the top level of Microsoft solutions partners. The Microsoft Partner Program was launched in October 2003 and represents Microsoft's ongoing commitment to the success of partners worldwide. The program offers a single, integrated partnering framework that recognizes partner expertise, rewards the total impact that partners have in the technology marketplace, and delivers value that helps partners' businesses be successful. Microsoft's ISV/Software Solutions competency provides exclusive benefits and support to Microsoft Gold Certified Partners who specialize in developing and marketing packaged software solutions based on Microsoft technologies. As a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner, Ensim has developed a close working relationship with Microsoft and receives a rich set of benefits, including access, training and technical support for the latest versions of Active Directory, SharePoint, Office Communication Server (OCS), Exchange, and Microsoft mobility solutions. As a result, Ensim customers gain a cost-effective way to ensure the compliance and security of their Microsoft infrastructure by automating key business policies with software supplied by Ensim. Ensim Unify is the leading software solution for infrastructure, directory, and applications management. Ensim Unify is used by service providers and enterprises worldwide to accelerate and enable deployment of integrated solutions, simplify and automate secure management of complex environments, and increase user and IT productivity. "In today's competitive environment, it is more important than ever to utilize all available resources in order to offer the best products possible," said Scott Young, vice president of marketing and product management at Ensim. "Our Microsoft gold competency serves to further demonstrate Ensim's continued commitment to our worldwide customer base to provide the best possible solutions leveraging Microsoft technologies." About Ensim Corporation Founded in 1998, Ensim Corporation is the leading provider of enterprise class and carrier grade solutions to manage and automate user and entitlement provisioning for unified communication and collaboration applications, cloud services, and virtual desktops and servers. Ensim products are used by Service Providers and Enterprises worldwide to accelerate and enable deployment of integrated solutions, simplify and automate secure management of complex environments, and increase user and IT productivity. Ensim has over two million users under management and is Microsoft Gold Certified. For more information, visit www.ensim.com or contact Ensim at 1-877-693-6746 or 1-408-496-3700 outside the United States. Ensim and the Ensim logo are registered trademarks of Ensim. All trademarks or registered trademarks contained herein are the property of their respective owners. entry.headline: Microsoft Tech•Ed 2011: DataCore Software Adds Extra Data Protection, Flexibility and Speed to Windows Home Server with DriveHarmony
entry.body:
Microsoft Tech•Ed 2011: DataCore Software Adds Extra Data Protection, Flexibility and Speed to Windows Home Server with DriveHarmony

Welcomes Beta Testers to Trial DriveHarmony’s New Pooling, Mirroring and Caching Features That Boost Performance and Sidestep Hard Disk Drive Limitations

DataCore Software, the industry’s premier provider of storage virtualization software, today announced the Beta release of DriveHarmony™, a simple to use add-on software package for Microsoft Windows Home Server (WHS). Users who are eager to protect, pool, accelerate, and easily expand storage capacity are welcome to request an early version of DriveHarmony for their personal beta testing by visiting DataCore’s booth (#1629) at this week’s Microsoft Tech•Ed 2011 or by sending a request to WHS@DataCore.com.

Easily Pool and Expand Storage to Simplify File Sharing and Folder Management

Leveraging techniques learned from a decade of experience in large data centers across the globe, DataCore™ DriveHarmony maximizes the value home users get from their hard disk drives. The software integrates into the familiar WHS dashboard with a simple, easy-to-use control panel. From there, users can combine one or more physical disks of variable sizes and types into one “Virtual Big Disk” pool. When this virtual drive is created, it is automatically initialized, formatted, assigned a drive letter, and selectively mirrored for data protection. The virtual drive is then ready for use by any application running on the WHS 2011 operating system.

Growing with the Needs of Today’s Digital Lifestyle

As families and small businesses gather more digital assets, their disk space consumption naturally grows. DriveHarmony delivers the right combination of power, capacity, and ease-of-use for today’s home consumers. It allows them to expand appropriately by adding more drives to virtual disks without having to split up or re-organize their files. The rest is done behind the scenes without any need for intervention.

“With more and more content going digital, people increasingly want a simple way to access, store, and enjoy the wide range of photos, personal videos, music, and films they save at home,” said Carlos M. Carreras, vice president of alliances and business development, DataCore Software. “Through the gathering of feedback during the beta process, we look forward to working closely with Microsoft and the Windows Home Server Community to bring to market a powerful solution to help home users easily protect, organize, and manage their growing disk requirements in a digital age.”

Availability

DriveHarmony is currently in Beta release and will be rolled out via select OEMs later this year. Visitors to DataCore’s booth (#1629) at Microsoft Tech•Ed 2011 can request an early version of DriveHarmony for their personal beta testing. Prospective beta users can also send an email request to WHS@DataCore.com.

Tech•Ed takes place at the Georgia World Congress Center in Atlanta from Monday, May 16 until Thursday, May 19, 2011.

About DataCore Software

DataCore Software is the industry’s premier provider of storage virtualization software. Its software-as infrastructure platform solves the big problem stalling virtualization initiatives by eliminating the storage-related barriers that make virtualization too difficult and too expensive. For additional information, visit the DataCore website at www.datacore.com or call (877) 780-5111.

DataCore, the DataCore logo and DriveHarmony are trademarks or registered trademarks of DataCore Software Corporation. Other DataCore product or service names or logos referenced herein are trademarks of DataCore Software Corporation. All other products, services and company names mentioned herein may be trademarks of their respective owners.

DataCore SoftwareStuart Smith, 954-377-6032stuart.smith@datacore.com and publicrelations@datacore.comorDavies Murphy Group (DMG)Toni Iafrate, 781-418-2406datacore@daviesmurphy.com

entry.headline: United States Patent and Trademark Office Suspends Coca-Cola's Opposition Motion Against Apple Rush Co., Inc. CEO
entry.body: GLENVIEW, IL, May 17 (MARKET WIRE) -- Apple Rush Co., Inc. (PINKSHEETS: APRU) announced today that pursuant to the motion of Robert Corr, President and CEO of Apple Rush Co., Inc., the motion opposed by The Coca-Cola Company; the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB) granted Robert Corr's motion, and suspended the opposition proceeding against Robert J. Corr by The Coca-Cola Company surrounding the trademark registration application of the Naturally ZERO mark. The filing can be found by visiting: http://ttabvue.uspto.gov/ttabvue/v?pno=91197767=OPP=12. Robert Corr and Apple Rush plan to begin the manufacturing, marketing and distribution of its Naturally ZERO product line through Apple Rush distribution channels. Robert Corr and Apple Rush previously decided to cease activity regarding Naturally ZERO until the USPTO came to this decision regarding The Coca Cola Company's opposition papers. Coke filed an opposition (No.91197767) against Robert Corr, president of Apple Rush Co. Inc. the applicant for the mark. A hearing was held by the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board and a Motion filed by the Applicant (Apple Rush) to suspend proceedings until a case (United States District Court For The Northern District Of Illinois Eastern Division No. 08 CV 04206) filed by the Plaintiff, Mirza N. Baig, and currently pending, against Coke for Trademark Infringement and false Designation of Origin under the Lanham Act. Robert Corr entered into a contract for the benefit of Apple Rush, with the Plaintiff, Mr. Baig, in that case to introduce The NATURALLY ZERO waters here in the United States and to renew the trademark. The trademark was originally used by Mr. Baig in commerce, including here in the Midwest during the period from 1999 to 2003, when Coke usurped the trademark from the Plaintiff and commenced its illegal use of the trademark on COKE ZERO. The agreement signed by Robert Corr, for the benefit of Apple Rush Co Inc., permits the use by Apple Rush. "This action by Mr. Baig against Coke, demonstrates that the trademark Zero is not owned by Coke. Yesterday, the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board granted my motion to suspend Coke's opposition. I intend to demonstrate the inconsistency between arguments made by Coke in the case filed by Mr. Baig, and Coke's oppositions against Royal Crown, Unilever and many others attempting to use the ZERO mark for beverages," says Robert Corr. Apple Rush will be introducing the Naturally ZERO Waters in the Chicagoland market this summer. About Apple Rush Co., Inc.: Apple Rush Company, Inc. is a producer of Organic 100% Juice Sparkling Beverages and Naturally ZERO Waters. The company markets its products through an extensive distribution network nearly 30 Distributors throughout the U.S. and in foreign markets. The Company's flagship product line of Organic Apple Rush(TM) Sparkling Beverages currently has four mainstream flavors in glass bottles and will introduce the waters this summer. Safe Harbor: The Company relies upon the Safe Harbor Laws of 1933, 1934 and 1995 for all public news releases. Statements, which are not historical facts, are forward-looking statements. entry.headline: Libya, Japan & Global Outlook - Equity Research on Chevron Corporation and Petroleo Brasileiro
entry.body: HONG KONG, May 17 (MARKET WIRE) -- Today, www.WorldStreetFundamentals.com released its industry report highlighting Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) and Petroleo Brasileiro (NYSE: PBR) (BAE: APBR). Full fundamental and technical analysis is available at www.WorldStreetFundamentals.com/Reports.php. With the disruption of exports from Libya and unrest in the Middle East and North Africa, crude oil continues to trend upward. The recent disaster in Japan has fueled further volatility, as Japan is the world's third largest consumer and the second largest importer. As of March, the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) estimated that global oil demand expanded by 2.85% in 2010 and sees demand growth of 1.70% in 2011 and 1.94% in 2012. Reflecting new OPEC capacity additions, the EIA estimated that global oil supply increased by 2.5% in 2010 and forecast supply growth of 1.12% in 2011 and 2.49% in 2012 World Street Fundamentals has highlighted Chevron because of focus on both upstream and downstream operations. Upstream operations consist of exploring for, developing and producing crude oil and natural gas; transporting crude oil by international oil export pipelines; transporting, storage and marketing of natural gas, and a gas-to-liquids project. Downstream operations consist of refining of crude oil into petroleum products marketing of crude oil and refined products. The entire report on Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) is available here: www.WorldStreetFundamentals.com/ViewFullReport.245.php. World Street has highlighted Petroleo Brasileiro for its diverse business across five segments: exploration and production; refining, transportation and marketing; distribution; gas and power, and international. The exploration and production segment includes oil and gas exploration, development and production in Brazil. The refining, transportation and marketing segment includes downstream activities in Brazil, including refining, logistics, transportation, oil products and crude oil exports and imports, petrochemicals and fertilizers. The distribution segment includes distribution of oil products through the BR retail network in Brazil. The gas and power segment includes gas transportation and distribution, electric power generation using natural gas and renewable energy sources. The international segment includes exploration and production, refining, transportation and marketing, distribution and gas and power operations outside of Brazil. The entire report on Petroleo Brasileiro (NYSE: PBR) (BAE: APBR) is available here: www.WorldStreetFundamentals.com/ViewFullReport.138.php. About World Street World Street Fundamentals is an online portal for professionals, investors and new-comers to the markets to find in depth comprehensive research and research tools to help guide you through the ever changing financial markets. Contact: Adam Redford editor@worldstreetfundamentals.com www.WorldStreetFundamentals.com Copyright 2011, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: AppSense Exceptional Growth Results in Microsoft Managed Partner Status
entry.body:
AppSense Exceptional Growth Results in Microsoft Managed Partner Status

Elevated status with Microsoft confirms user virtualization market leader continues to surge forward with 50-plus percent annual growth and $70M investment from Goldman Sachs

Microsoft TechEd, AppSense booth #701 – AppSense, the leading provider of user virtualization technology, has been elevated to a Managed Independent Software Vendor (ISV) Partner status by Microsoft Corp. The company was previously a High Potential Partner since 2009.

Less than five percent of Microsoft ISV partners achieve Managed ISV Partner status, a category reserved for high-growth companies with significant joint revenue potential. As a Managed ISV Partner, AppSense will work closely with Microsoft to ensure its popular user virtualization platform enhances and extends the enterprise user management capabilities of Microsoft System Center, Windows Server and Windows Client. User virtualization significantly reduces the IT burden and cost associated with onboarding and deploying users on enterprise desktops, especially during migrations and deployments of new desktop and application delivery technologies.

“User virtualization will become an important category for the enterprise. We believe that every company will be challenged with a mix of physical, virtual desktop and application delivery technologies,” says David Roussain, AppSense’s vice president of Strategic Technology Alliances. “Ensuring IT pros successfully manage users across these technologies is key to ensuring on-time rollouts with zero user disruption. Most companies redesigning their desktop architecture to take advantage of new, more efficient technologies such as Windows 7 and Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) find that user-related challenges can become an obstacle to deployment.”

“We are pleased to see AppSense extend Microsoft’s User State Virtualization to deliver enhanced capabilities that help customers manage their employees’ data and settings across physical and virtual environments. The combination of AppSense with our Desktop Virtualization technologies, such as App-V or VDI Suites, can enable customers to move to Windows 7 even more quickly,” said Karri Alexion-Tiernan, director of product management for desktop virtualization at Microsoft.

AppSense recently received a $70 million investment from Goldman Sachs for market expansion and new product development. Currently staffed with 300 employees, the company anticipates adding 150 new staff in 2011.

Supporting Resources

For the latest news and information, follow AppSense on the web at:

Company Blog Twitter YouTube

About AppSense

AppSense, the leading provider of user virtualization solutions, makes physical and virtual desktop deployment possible by ensuring a seamless user experience across all delivery platforms. AppSense accelerates multi-platform desktop deployments by eliminating costly user management tools, enabling single-image application delivery, and ensuring users have the same experience from any desktop. AppSense technology is used around the world by companies such as JPMorgan Chase, Lowes, United Airlines, Wachovia and ESPN. AppSense has offices in New York and San Jose in the US, London and Manchester in the UK, and additional offices in Munich, Melbourne, Amsterdam, Paris and Oslo. For more information, visit www.appsense.com.

Mindshare PRHeather Fitzsimmons, +1-650-947-7400heather@mindsharepr.com

entry.headline: Microsoft and StorSimple to Host Webinar on Cloud Storage Best Practices for the Enterprise
entry.body:
Microsoft and StorSimple to Host Webinar on Cloud Storage Best Practices for the Enterprise

Webinar to Feature Rockford Construction’s Award Winning Usage of Windows Azure and StorSimple

StorSimple, the leading provider of Windows optimized Hybrid Cloud Storage technology, today announced a joint webinar with Microsoft featuring Rockford Construction’s award winning usage of Windows Azure and StorSimple.

The cloud has some inherent advantages when it comes to storage - instant thin provisioning, unlimited elastic expansion, built in high-availability- available anywhere in the world. To learn more about storage in the cloud and hear how one company is driving best practices in cloud storage with StorSimple and Windows Azure, don’t miss the upcoming Academy Live session, “Hybrid Cloud Storage for the Enterprise – Best Practice – StorSimple, Windows Azure and Rockford Construction Case Study” on Tuesday May 24, 2011, 8:00 AM PDT.

During this FREE one-hour session, you will learn how to deliver a cloud-as-a-tier architecture to get secure, high-performance enterprise storage with cloud data protection. You will also learn how StorSimple’s hybrid cloud storage appliance can quickly integrate Windows Azure into existing native and virtualized enterprise applications with no change to the application or infrastructure. Finally, Rockford Construction’s Vice President of IT, Shawn Partridge, will discuss how Rockford Construction has used StorSimple and Windows Azure to drive cloud economics and manage significant growth for the company.

Click here to learn more and to register.

Everyone that registers will receive:

A free copy of the new eBook: “Cloud-as-a-Tier - Building an Enterprise Architecture For Secure High-Performance Hybrid Cloud Storage” Rockford Construction Case Study and Extended Podcast Interview

About StorSimple

StorSimple is the leading provider of hybrid cloud storage solution for Windows infrastructures. It has achieved the most stringent “Certified for Windows Server 2008” level of certification. StorSimple securely and transparently integrates the cloud into on-premises applications and offers a single appliance that delivers high-performance tiered storage, live archiving, cloud based data protection and disaster recovery, reducing cost by up to 90 percent compared to traditional enterprise storage. StorSimple is based in Silicon Valley and is funded by Ignition Partners, Index Ventures, Mayfield Fund, and Redpoint Ventures.

Lois Paul PartnersMichele Moore, 781-782-5763michele_moore@lpp.com
